\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip01_23\".m_mContent: "Seeing this many test subjects from the El Dorado here is both bad and good news—"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip01_24\".m_mContent: "The bad news... the El Dorado has most likely sunk..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip01_25\".m_mContent: "But if the Blood Beasts and I all washed up on this island, the ship must have went down near the coast. There's a good chance the others made it too."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip01_26\".m_mContent: "They just came from that direction. If I follow the beach, I might find more survivors."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_01\".m_mContent: "Is this the other end of the beach? It looks like I've walked the entire coastline on this side of the island."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_02\".m_mContent: "I haven't seen any traces of other people along the way, nor any wreckage from the El Dorado. Could Empousa and the others be somewhere on this island?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_03\".m_mContent: "I shouldn't jump to conclusions. I've only explored this side of the island. Who knows what I'll find inland or on the other coast."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_04\".m_mContent: "Am I even sure this is an island?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_05\".m_mContent: "I've been walking along this coast for quite some time since I came to, yet the daylight hasn't changed at all."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_06\".m_mContent: "It's as if the sun is constantly watching me, hanging motionless at the edge of the sky, just out of reach."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_07\".m_mContent: "And apart from those Black Blood crabs, I haven't seen any other living creatures."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_08\".m_mContent: "Along with that chaotic dream... this place feels almost like... the 'afterlife.'"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_09\".m_mContent: "Maybe I actually drowned at sea? That would explain a few things. Is there a place where the sun never sets... Wait..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_10\".m_mContent: "...'The location of the next Moonblessed and the home of the silver-haired heretic lie toward the sunset.' That's what Cain said."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_11\".m_mContent: "We boarded Goldland's ship precisely because only the El Dorado could reach the legendary Sunset Isle."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_12\".m_mContent: "If the ship was sailing toward Sunset Isle the entire time... Perhaps we were already close to our destination when Famine awakened?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_13\".m_mContent: "Then... could this be that legendary place? Have I ended up here due to sheer coincidence?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_14\".m_mContent: "But I still haven't seen another soul. If only someone could shed some light on all this... anyone would do—"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_19\".m_mContent: "I... I'm okay... It's just... I fell and hurt my leg when I got startled. Ow..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_22\".m_mContent: "Oh I'm sorry, I mean I'm so relieved to finally see another soul out here."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_23\".m_mContent: "Ah... Th-Thank you for saving me. I've always been... scared of the dark... and wild animals."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_24\".m_mContent: "I have a lot I'd like to ask you, but let's find somewhere safe first."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_25\".m_mContent: "Okay but... I don't think I can walk... I'm really sorry for being such a burden."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_26\".m_mContent: "Don't worry, I'll take care of these old friends of mine. We can have a long chat after."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_28\".m_mContent: "Well... I guess they don't see it that way anymore."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_29\".m_mContent: "Seeing them like this, I can't help but feel sorry for them."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_30\".m_mContent: "But they were trying to kill us moments ago."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_31\".m_mContent: "I mean it's sad that they were used as test subjects. Maybe their former selves never meant to hurt anyone."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_32\".m_mContent: "But those who did this to them must have had their reasons too... I suppose this is what master often referred to as 'survival of the fittest.'"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_33\".m_mContent: "...We don't know if we'll run into them again here. We should find somewhere that's safe."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_34\".m_mContent: "Oh, my clothes are all dirty... Your clothes... they look very expensive..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_35\".m_mContent: "Ah, I think that's the first time someone's said that to me. This isn't really my usual style of dress."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_36\".m_mContent: "Anyway, how's your leg? Does it still hurt? I could carry you on my back..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_38\".m_mContent: "It's much better now. I should be able to walk..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip02_40\".m_mContent: "Those crabs have the advantage on this coastal terrain. Let's head inland first. There's also something I want to check on the way."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_05\".m_mContent: "It appears to be just a sprain, but you should still be careful."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_07\".m_mContent: "Just call me Noah. By the way..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_08\".m_mContent: "Um, my name is P-Piera Paracelsus... You can just call me Piera."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_09\".m_mContent: "Piera... There's no need to be so nervous. Are you not used to talking to strangers?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_10\".m_mContent: "I'm just... used to being alone. I don't know what to say..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_11\".m_mContent: "Is that why I didn't see you on the ship? Were you by yourself the whole time?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_13\".m_mContent: "Wait, you weren't a passenger on the El Dorado?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_14\".m_mContent: "N-No, I wasn't. I came here to find my hometown..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_15\".m_mContent: "You lived here? Are there other people living on this island?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_17\".m_mContent: "I've never actually lived here. Most of what I know I heard from my family."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_18\".m_mContent: "They told me Sunset Isle was the ancestral home of our family, the Paracelsuses... This is my first time here."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_22\".m_mContent: "Ah, sorry for getting carried away. I didn't mean to startle you."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_23\".m_mContent: "Could this really be just a coincidence? After everything that happened on the El Dorado, I still ended up here—"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_24\".m_mContent: "This island, where the next Moonblessed is supposed to be, and the location of my hometown, according to Cain..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_26\".m_mContent: "They followed us all the way here?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_29\".m_mContent: "Alright, stay close to me. Let's take care of these guys first... I still have a lot of questions for you."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_31\".m_mContent: "Are you alright? You've been breathing heavily this whole time."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_32\".m_mContent: "I'm... hah... just a bit... tired... I'll be... I'll be fine... after I catch my breath..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_33\".m_mContent: "Earlier you mentioned you had something to ask me?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_34\".m_mContent: "I was told that my hometown is on Sunset Isle."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_35\".m_mContent: "Then you're also from here? And you've only heard about it from others... Could we be in the same boat?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_36\".m_mContent: "Not exactly. You were raised somewhere else, but me, I lost my mem—I mean, I can't remember much about my past."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_37\".m_mContent: "But since this was also your family's origins... Is there any chance you've heard someone mention me?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_38\".m_mContent: "Um, I don't have many friends, and I rarely talk to other people... I'm really sorry..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_39\".m_mContent: "No, it was just wishful thinking on my part. I should've known it wouldn't be that—Huh?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_41\".m_mContent: "I thought I just saw a person walk by over there..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_42\".m_mContent: "You said this was your first time here, but surely you arrived before me. Do you know when you got here?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_43\".m_mContent: "Today... but maybe not. I really can't tell, because..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_45\".m_mContent: "Yes... my mother told me about the legend of this island. 'Our home is forever chasing the sun across the sea, so night never falls...'"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_47\".m_mContent: "Nevernight... Wow, your name is just like the legend! So you really are from here!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_48\".m_mContent: "Getting back to what I wanted to ask—have you seen anyone else since you've been here?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_49\".m_mContent: "N-No... Besides those crabs, you're the first soul I've seen."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip03_50\".m_mContent: "Then that figure I saw... was it my imagination?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_01\".m_mContent: "Was it really just my imagination? That figure I saw... I think they were going this way..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_04\".m_mContent: "No, it's my fault. I got caught up in the moment."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_06\".m_mContent: "This thing is a little heavy. I just need a moment to catch my breath..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_07\".m_mContent: "I've been meaning to ask, why have you been carrying that coffin this whole time?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_11\".m_mContent: "Now I'm certain there are people here. Stay here, I'm going to get to the bottom of this!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_12\".m_mContent: "Where did she go... Have you found Dr. Ressa?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_13\".m_mContent: "I've looked all over, but she's nowhere to be seen. With everything that's happening on the island right now..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_14\".m_mContent: "Dr. Ressa is our last hope... She's the only one who can save us from turning into those monsters!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_17\".m_mContent: "It is you! The young man who's always with Dr. Ressa!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_19\".m_mContent: "This is no time for jokes. Where's the doctor? You two were inseparable!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_21\".m_mContent: "I can't even remember anything about her..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_22\".m_mContent: "Stop talking nonsense. Just tell us where the doctor is."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_23\".m_mContent: "Maybe he really doesn't know... Remember, Dr. Ressa said that Noah was a 'person without memories.'"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_25\".m_mContent: "Damnit! Just when I thought we found a lead on the doctor, it's just an empty shell who can't remember anything!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_27\".m_mContent: "*cough* I don't want to die... I don't... want to die alone... You're coming with me!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_28\".m_mContent: "It's all your fault! Dr. Ressa abandoned us because of you, and now look what's become of this island."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_30\".m_mContent: "You doomed us all! You should be the one rotting in the ground, Noah Nevernight!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_31\".m_mContent: "What are they saying... I... I can't remember anything."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_32\".m_mContent: "Noah, no matter what happens, you must have faith in yourself."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_33\".m_mContent: "You must live on. I'll be waiting for you here, always..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_34\".m_mContent: "This voice... why does it sound so familiar? So comforting..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_35\".m_mContent: "Thank you for waking me up. I promise I'll remember... remember who you are!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_36\".m_mContent: "Bring back Dr. Ressa! Bring back our families!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_37\".m_mContent: "Give back everything you took from us, Noah Nevernight!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_38\".m_mContent: "Tell me what I did, why you hate me so much. Did I really live on this island?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_39\".m_mContent: "What is my connection to Ressa? What did I do to this island?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_40\".m_mContent: "Hah... Hahaha... Oh, you'll remember eventually. You'll remember everything."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_41\".m_mContent: "And when you do, we will be waiting for you—at the place of your true birth!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_46\".m_mContent: "Of course... Why would you ask that?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_47\".m_mContent: "...Sorry. I just had a really strange encounter. It's still messing with my head."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_48\".m_mContent: "Was it... people who vanish into thin air?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_49\".m_mContent: "You saw them too?! Do you know who they are?! Did they hurt you?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_50\".m_mContent: "She appeared... not long after you left..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_51\".m_mContent: "Was it someone from the island? Did they attack you?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_52\".m_mContent: "No... the person who appeared was... my grandmother..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_53\".m_mContent: "Your grandmother? Is she on this island? No, that can't be, a normal person can't just vanish..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_54\".m_mContent: "My grandmother passed away a long time ago. And..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_55\".m_mContent: "The person I saw was much younger than the grandmother I remember..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_57\".m_mContent: "She said... Welcome back to the home of the sunset, to the... 'resting place of memories.'"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_58\".m_mContent: "Piera, maybe this island really is our home after all."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_59\".m_mContent: "There are people who recognize us here, but also secrets that are beyond our understanding."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_60\".m_mContent: "If we get separated again, this gesture will be our way of telling it's the real us."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_62\".m_mContent: "Let's go. All the crazy things that we've encountered so far..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_63\".m_mContent: "I don't think it's just the island welcoming us home."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_64\".m_mContent: "...Why did Noah choose that particular gesture?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip04_65\".m_mContent: "Is it really just a coincidence? What do you think?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_01\".m_mContent: "Ah, what a perfect chance to unwind—"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_04\".m_mContent: "Didn't I tell you to catch a boat back to the Church without me? Why are you still here?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_05\".m_mContent: "A Vice-Commander's sworn duty is to protect their Bell Ringer."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_06\".m_mContent: "Listen to yourself. How many Bell Ringers do you know need a bodyguard?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_07\".m_mContent: "I do not know the answer to that, but the Saint said..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_08\".m_mContent: "It's always 'Saint this' and 'Saint that.' That old hag didn't assign you Vice-Commanders to us for our safety..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_11\".m_mContent: "What I mean is... Argh! Just forget it."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_12\".m_mContent: "I can't believe I actually thought about trying to explain this to Darcias."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_13\".m_mContent: "Well, since I can't have any alone time, let's just go find our 'objective.'"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_15\".m_mContent: "Yes, this is all his fault! Making me suffer that infernal boat ride and having to step foot on this bizarre island again."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_16\".m_mContent: "Even though we, The Choir, were the ones who captured him on this very island 66 years ago, he still remains a thorn in my side."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_17\".m_mContent: "Orders are orders. He escaped some days ago and they tasked us with recapturing him."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_18\".m_mContent: "Do you really buy that? Oh, Darcias, you really do believe everything you're told."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_19\".m_mContent: "Are you saying he did not escape?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_20\".m_mContent: "For the past 66 years, Death has been sealed beneath the cathedral. It's impossible for him to escape on his own."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_21\".m_mContent: "I do not understand what you're getting at."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_22\".m_mContent: "Someone deliberately let him go. A traitor within our ranks."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_23\".m_mContent: "But he was kept in the central chamber..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_24\".m_mContent: "And there lies the problem. Within the Church, only the Bell Ringers are allowed access to that place. So the traitor..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_27\".m_mContent: "But if there's really a traitor in league with the Calamity among the twelve Bell Ringers... I can't even fathom the catastrophe it would bring."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_28\".m_mContent: "How could the Saint not know about this?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_29\".m_mContent: "Tch, this is why I can't stand that old hag. She acts like she knows everything, but never lifts a finger..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_30\".m_mContent: "That is the will of Aeon, perhaps?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_31\".m_mContent: "We're not here to worry about the Saint. Our priority is to capture Death after he 'escaped.'"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_34\".m_mContent: "If he's been gone for days, why are we searching here?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_35\".m_mContent: "Because when we captured him the first time, he left something very important here..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_36\".m_mContent: "Hey now, little ones, it's not polite to eavesdrop."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_39\".m_mContent: "How peculiar. Blood Beasts don't just vanish upon death."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_40\".m_mContent: "I thought they were just wild beasts."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_41\".m_mContent: "Have you forgotten? The Gravekeepers of the Paracelsus family, who have lived on this island for generations—their Blood awakening takes the form of wild boars."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_42\".m_mContent: "66 years ago, when the Black Blood disease ravaged this island, we fought many of their transformed kin..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_43\".m_mContent: "Hold on... The transformed Gravekeepers from 66 years ago just materialized before us and vanished just the same"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_46\".m_mContent: "These creatures... they're not Blood Beasts at all."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_48\".m_mContent: "Shush! I'm trying to connect the pieces."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_50\".m_mContent: "Look, if you come across creatures like the ones we just dispatched, don't waste your time on them."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_51\".m_mContent: "They're neither beast nor Blood Beast. In fact, they don't even exist."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_52\".m_mContent: "All things on this island should have perished on that fateful day 66 years ago—"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_53\".m_mContent: "Everything you saw, and will see, are merely 'shades' formed from the lingering longings of those devoured by Death—nothing more."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip05_54\".m_mContent: "Longings? But... if we can see them, does that mean we also have a longing for something on this island?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_01\".m_mContent: "Piera, are you sure we're going the right way?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_02\".m_mContent: "'Grandmother' just told me that this island is actually quite small. If we head inland towards the mountain, we'll find the island's only village at its base."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_03\".m_mContent: "That makes sense... If Empousa and the others ended up here too, they'd probably look for village first. Well, Aiona would, at least."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_04\".m_mContent: "But you said your grandmother told you? I don't recall seeing anyone that could be your grandmother on the way here."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_05\".m_mContent: "Well... um... I know it's hard to believe since you couldn't see her..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_06\".m_mContent: "I'm not doubting you, Piera. I'm just wondering if it's possible... that we're not seeing the same people?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_07\".m_mContent: "Noah... you don't think I'm just making this up... do you?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_08\".m_mContent: "I did have that thought at first, which is why I didn't respond when the islanders greeted me along the way."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_09\".m_mContent: "But you, on the other hand, seem genuinely unaware of their existence."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_10\".m_mContent: "O-Oh, I see... Noah, you're... really perceptive, aren't you..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_11\".m_mContent: "From my observations, you have occasionally interacted with 'people' that I can't see. But these interactions seemed to be genuine."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_14\".m_mContent: "S-Sorry... I promise I won't get scared. I won't cause you any trouble."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_15\".m_mContent: "I may not be able to see your grandmother, but I could see how happy you were when you were talking with her. Even though..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_16\".m_mContent: "...You know she passed away many years ago."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_18\".m_mContent: "My grandmother was the one who raised me, and I miss her so much... I just want to talk to her again, even if it's just an illusion from my longing."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_19\".m_mContent: "Noah, do you remember what I always used to say?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_20\".m_mContent: "'Behind every frightful specter lies a soul that someone else misses dearly.'"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_22\".m_mContent: "Ugh... What... What am I saying!? Ressa... Who's Ressa?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_23\".m_mContent: "Ressa is the island's best doctor. She's our only hope for survival..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_24\".m_mContent: "But you, Noah Nevernight, you stole her from us."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_26\".m_mContent: "You stole our sun, our only hope."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_27\".m_mContent: "You brought death upon us, you turned us into these... abominations."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_28\".m_mContent: "I don't know what you're talking about! I don't remember any of you, I don't... I don't even remember who Ressa was..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_29\".m_mContent: "No, you just don't want to remember—you're terrified to face what you've done to all of us."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_30\".m_mContent: "How utterly despicable, Nevernight. You think you can wash away all your sins just by pretending to not remember?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_31\".m_mContent: "I truly don't know who you are, or what you want me to return. But let me make one thing clear..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_32\".m_mContent: "You have no idea who I am, the person I am now."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_33\".m_mContent: "I won't be manipulated by your words. I'll uncover the truth about my past on my own terms."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_34\".m_mContent: "...You are Noah Nevernight, indeed. You haven't changed at all. So self-absorbed, so cold... and yet... so strong..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_35\".m_mContent: "So you were... truly that special to Dr. Ressa...? No, I can't aceept it..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_37\".m_mContent: "Noah... are you alright? You look terribly pale..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_38\".m_mContent: "You suddenly started talking to yourself... and then drew your sword out of nowhere..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_39\".m_mContent: "I'm sorry for scaring you. It's probably because I've encountered all these people who seem to know me, yet I can't recognize them. My memories are all jumbled up."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_40\".m_mContent: "But that's not necessarily a bad thing, right, Noah? It means you've come to the right place... This is your 'homeland'—"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_41\".m_mContent: "If there are people here who remember you... that's proof that you existed here... This is where you've always belonged..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_42\".m_mContent: "When you meet those you truly yearn for and those who truly yearn for you, you'll surely remember everything."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_43a\".m_mContent: "Wait! Piera, do you remember what you said before?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_46\".m_mContent: "I miss her... and just want to see her again?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_48\".m_mContent: "Even if she is... an illusion... created from my longing."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_49\".m_mContent: "A homeland where the sun never sets, a lonely isle of the dead's longing—'Sunset Isle' is where I'll find the next 'Moonblessed' connected to my memories..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_50\".m_mContent: "Piera, I need to know—what exactly is inside that coffin you're carrying?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_51\".m_mContent: "W-What's wrong, Noah? You got really serious all of a sudden."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_53\".m_mContent: "Your true identity... could it be that you're the..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip06_54\".m_mContent: "—'Gravekeeper' of the Divine Body on this island?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_01\".m_mContent: "Why are you... suddenly asking me about that? What did the people you saw say to you?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_02\".m_mContent: "You've been acting strange. You can't see what I see, yet you assumed they said something to me..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_03\".m_mContent: "And you're obviously afraid of ghosts, yet you completely trust what 'they' have been telling you."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_05\".m_mContent: "You already knew about this island's strange phenomenon."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_06\".m_mContent: "But... but I wasn't lying. It really is my first time here... Even though... this is my hometown..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_07\".m_mContent: "I believe you. But that doesn't mean you haven't heard about this place... Perhaps from relatives who once lived here?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_09\".m_mContent: "It's your first time here too, but you've already figured out this island..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_10\".m_mContent: "That's because I've experienced this type of phenomenon twice before."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_12\".m_mContent: "A few days ago, I walked into a cave and was sent 20 years into the past; then, just before arriving on this island, I boarded a ship that could 'devour people.'"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_13\".m_mContent: "Noah... you've really been through a lot, haven't you..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_14\".m_mContent: "I appreciate the concern. But it was the presence of a Divine Body that linked those two events."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_15\".m_mContent: "...Divine Body? I've only read about them in my grandmother's books. I never imagined you would have encountered them firsthand, and twice at that..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_16\".m_mContent: "So it was your grandmother who told you about this island?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_17\".m_mContent: "Yes... As you deduced, the Paracelsus family has been the 'Gravekeepers' of Sunset Isle for generations."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_19\".m_mContent: "Please forgive me if my pronunciation is off."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_20\".m_mContent: "It seems you've met the Gravekeepers from other families... haven't you, Noah...?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_21\".m_mContent: "Yes, we've been through a lot together. They're all precious companions to me now."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_22\".m_mContent: "I see... I'm a bit envious of them, because I've always... been alone..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_23\".m_mContent: "As you already know, Noah... I'm the last remaining member of the Paracelsus family..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_24\".m_mContent: "The Gravekeeper's duty... naturally fell to me, the only one left..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_25\".m_mContent: "So, your family's duty must be to..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_26\".m_mContent: "Naturally you'd know, Noah... Yes... it's to guard the Calamity sealed on this island."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_27\".m_mContent: "You've been so open with me. I shouldn't keep this from you either. The truth is..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_28\".m_mContent: "The reason my companions and I came to Sunset Isle was to find the Calamity—or as we call it, the 'Moonblessed.'"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_29\".m_mContent: "...Oh. So you didn't come because this is your hometown, Noah?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_30\".m_mContent: "No, that's also one of the reasons. I nearly lost my life, and more importantly, I lost all my memories..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_31\".m_mContent: "I don't remember who I am or where I'm from. At first... I wasn't even sure if I wanted to find the answers."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_32\".m_mContent: "Who am I? What kind of person was I in the past? Does it really matter?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_33\".m_mContent: "Then why, Noah... why do you still..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_34\".m_mContent: "It's because of my companions—the blurred figure in my memories who promised to wait for my return; and now, those by my side striving towards our common goal, the Moonblessed."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_35\".m_mContent: "I hesitated. I thought about becoming a different person, discarding all of my past... but I just couldn't do it."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_36\".m_mContent: "Even if I've lost the past I can't remember, I still have the present with them. I will never abandon these companions who've walked this road with me."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_37\".m_mContent: "Piera, what's wrong? Why are you crying...?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_38\".m_mContent: "After hearing your words, I realized... how I'm the complete opposite of you... It's so frustrating..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_39\".m_mContent: "I know who I am, I know where I'm from, I know my duty—I haven't forgotten anything..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_40\".m_mContent: "I want so badly to tell Grandmother, to tell everyone on the island... 'I'm Piera... I've come home today...'"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_41\".m_mContent: "I remember my family's duty... I've learned so much from the Church's teachers... I've grown up, I'm no longer that timid child who cried at everything, and yet..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_42\".m_mContent: "And when I finally summoned the courage to speak these truths... I found myself utterly alone."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_46\".m_mContent: "Because... I've finally been able to get everything off my chest, and there's even someone to listen to me."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_48\".m_mContent: "Yes... Noah, you're not just a phantom, right? You're a real, living person, right?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_49\".m_mContent: "I sure hope so. At least, I feel like I'm alive. But come to think of it, how should we define being 'alive'..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_50\".m_mContent: "Noah, are you... the type to get hung up on these philosophical questions?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_51\".m_mContent: "...That's not what I meant to discuss with you... I just thought, rather than being sad about the lonely past..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_52\".m_mContent: "I should be grateful for the person who's here in the present, who's willing to listen... A kind person who values their companions."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_53\".m_mContent: "And here I thought you weren't much of a talker."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_54\".m_mContent: "Noah, you just said... you came to the island to find the Calamity, right? But you called it a Moonblessed?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_55\".m_mContent: "Well... it's complicated. Can you tell me what you know about the Calamity first."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_56\".m_mContent: "Yes, to thank you for helping me, I'll tell you what I know of the Calamity from my grandmother and family members."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_57\".m_mContent: "Where to begin... Ah, yes. My grandmother told me that up until 66 years ago... all members of our family were still living on this island..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_59\".m_mContent: "Wh-what's going on!? Is... is something there?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_60\".m_mContent: "We're being attacked by Blood Beasts. You can't see them?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_62\".m_mContent: "Then can we assume they can't harm you either?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_63\".m_mContent: "Grandmother did tell me about the rules governing these phantoms, but she never mentioned if the ones we can't see could be harmful..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_64\".m_mContent: "Let me take care of these, then you can explain these rules to me!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_65\".m_mContent: "So these are indeed phantoms... What are the rules that determine how they appear and to whom?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_66\".m_mContent: "It's people's longings... Grandmother said that due to the influence of the Divine Body somewhere on Sunset Isle, these phantoms of longing often materialize into physical form."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_67\".m_mContent: "And what each person sees is based on who they long for and those that long for them."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_68\".m_mContent: "...But those were wild boars. What possible longing could I have for them?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_69\".m_mContent: "Um... actually... instead of longing, perhaps memories might be more accurate?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_70\".m_mContent: "Memories? But I don't have any memories of them. Wait, does that mean..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_71\".m_mContent: "The Divine Body on this island can awaken memories that I can't remember?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_72\".m_mContent: "My grandmother probably never encountered someone with memory loss... so I'm afraid I wouldn't know..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_73\".m_mContent: "This feeling of memories being excavated from deep within my mind... It's as if I've experienced it somewhere not long ago..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_74\".m_mContent: "Either way, for now we only know that the Divine Body on this island is causing these phantoms to materialize based on people's longings."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_75\".m_mContent: "But for the Divine Body or the Calamity, I still have no idea where they are or what they look like..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_76\".m_mContent: "Grandmother... never told me about them either. What do you think, Noah... Where do you think they could be?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_77\".m_mContent: "The Divine Bodies I've encountered before didn't have any set forms. One turned out to be an entire cave, while another was a golden tree shaped like a ship's keel."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_78\".m_mContent: "So even if someone told me that the never-setting sun here was the Divine Body, I wouldn't find it surprising."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_79\".m_mContent: "The sun as the Divine Body? Noah, that's... very romantic..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_80\".m_mContent: "Well, it's just one of many theories. I have no means to prove it though."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_81\".m_mContent: "However, I have a strong feeling that the sealed Calamity is very close to us."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip07_83\".m_mContent: "We can easily check that, for example..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_01\".m_mContent: "When I first brought this up, you skillfully avoided the question..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_02\".m_mContent: "But I can't ignore the fact that you've been keeping secrets, especially with all these strange things going on."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_03\".m_mContent: "I... I would never hide something about the Calamity... but... this is different... I'm sorry..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_06\".m_mContent: "The village you mentioned before, it's in this direction, right?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_07\".m_mContent: "Noah... are you not going to ask anymore? Do you believe me?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_08\".m_mContent: "You are the Piera I know, so of course I believe you."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_09\".m_mContent: "If you say your secret is not related to the Calamity, that's enough for me."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_11\".m_mContent: "Secrets are like scars we all carry. A friend understands that."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_12\".m_mContent: "Let's get to that village before nightfall—Oh, I forgot the sun doesn't set here."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_14\".m_mContent: "The truth is... even if we find the village... there likely won't be anyone there..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_15\".m_mContent: "...There shouldn't be another living soul left on this island."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_16\".m_mContent: "So that's why you were so surprised when you first saw me, but remained calm when you saw the phantoms."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_17\".m_mContent: "Paracelsus... the Calamity that our family has sealed for generations..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_20\".m_mContent: "Grandmother said that since ancient times, our family has resided on this isolated island alongside the Calamity known as Death."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_21\".m_mContent: "As a result of this Calamity's influence, the members of our family... are cursed with very short lifespans, and the succession of Gravekeeper is frequent."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_22\".m_mContent: "Even so... our ancestors never feared Death. Instead..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_23\".m_mContent: "While guarding the Divine Body... they were also researching methods to completely eradicate Death."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_24\".m_mContent: "Is it because the sealed Calamity is still cursing the family members that they want to completely eradicate... the Calamity itself?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_25\".m_mContent: "The members of the Landis family we encountered covet the power of the Calamity; in contrast, the Paracelsus family are sworn mortal enemies of the Calamity."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_26\".m_mContent: "It appears that the families guarding the Divine Body each have their own different convictions and levels of resolve."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_27\".m_mContent: "Hold on a second! You just said there are no living people on this island now. That means your family's struggles..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_28\".m_mContent: "Yes, we failed... but not everyone died."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_29\".m_mContent: "Grandmother said she remembers that day vividly. 66 years ago, during a fierce thunderstorm, when the sun was completely shrouded by dark clouds..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_30\".m_mContent: "The village's best doctor claimed she had found a way to fight against Death, and needed everyone's help, but—"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_31\".m_mContent: "The method backfired, causing Death to break free from its seal instead?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_33\".m_mContent: "No... I'm just piecing things together based on what happened to your family. How things might have gone. But you said not everyone died—why is that?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_34\".m_mContent: "Because the Church suddenly arrived, as if they were already prepared for Death's awakening..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_35\".m_mContent: "The tenth Bell Ringer at the time arrived on the island with her 'Choir.'"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_36\".m_mContent: "The tenth Bell Ringer at the time...?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_37\".m_mContent: "Yes... that Bell Ringer ended up sacrificing herself during the battle against Death..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_38\".m_mContent: "Death... was that much stronger than a Bell Ringer?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_39\".m_mContent: "Grandmother said that at the time, the faithful across the entire continent were in a state of panic... People saw that the Church's Bell Ringers, who had always seemed invincible, could still be..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_40\".m_mContent: "But that was from 66 years ago... It's not surprising that you haven't heard about it, Noah..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_41\".m_mContent: "So after that, since Death never broke free, that means..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_42\".m_mContent: "Death might have won the fight... but it was also severely weakened... The remaining members of the Choir and the doctor were able to seal it again."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_43\".m_mContent: "Death, being far too dangerous... was sealed within the Church's territories, and the survivors of our family followed..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_44\".m_mContent: "Ah, so that's why you said you were learning from the Church's teachers, you were actually born and raised in the Church's territories..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_45\".m_mContent: "But Piera, if Death has been sealed in the Church's territories for the past 66 years, and the island has been abandoned by your family, why did you return now?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_46\".m_mContent: "Because... seven days ago, Death broke free from the Church's territories..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_48\".m_mContent: "Yes... and I overheard the teacher saying that Death would likely return here... As the last Gravekeeper of the Paracelsus family, it is my duty..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_49\".m_mContent: "Shortly after I arrived here, I met those crab friends... and you, Noah..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_50\".m_mContent: "That's all I know... The story from 66 years ago that my grandmother told me..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_53\".m_mContent: "If this island has been uninhabited for 66 years, how could it be my hometown?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_54\".m_mContent: "But I also saw those phantoms... So just who are they?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_57\".m_mContent: "N-No... it's not that... it's... it's Death. It..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_61\".m_mContent: "No... I... I don't know. It looks... it looks kind of like... like how grandmother described Death..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_62\".m_mContent: "This is Death?! Just going about in the open like this?!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_63\".m_mContent: "If this thing is capable of defeating even the Bell Ringers... I must create a chance for Piera to escape."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_64\".m_mContent: "Piera, hide behind me! Run as soon as you get the chance!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_66\".m_mContent: "It's the demon that destroyed your family and this island! You didn't come back just to offer up your life, did you?!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_68\".m_mContent: "Its voice... I think it's directly communicating with my mind. Noah... c-can you hear it too?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_69\".m_mContent: "I can. I'm actually getting used to this by now."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_70\".m_mContent: "The terrifying appearance, the inescapable whispers... just like the previous 'Calamities' I've encountered..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_71\".m_mContent: "So this really is... Death? The despair that our ancestors fought against for centuries, only to succumb to in the end?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_75\".m_mContent: "Noah... look carefully, that is not me."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_76\".m_mContent: "You must wake up! We made a promise..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_77\".m_mContent: "We both have to live on. We'll meet again someday... I know we will."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_78\".m_mContent: "Piera! Don't answer its call! Don't let it tamper with your memories!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_79\".m_mContent: "No... I don't... I... I can't hear the other voices!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_80\".m_mContent: "Think of happy thoughts! Remember your grandmother!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_81\".m_mContent: "Grand... Grandmother... I'm sorry... I... still can't do it..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_83\".m_mContent: "Its behavior changed? Is it targeting the Paracelsus bloodline now? Just like Famine..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_84\".m_mContent: "I won't let you lay a finger on her!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_87\".m_mContent: "For some reason, this thing's contamination doesn't seem to affect me. But in terms of raw fighting ability..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_88\".m_mContent: "You're a pitiful excuse for something called Death. The Calamities I've faced before were far more formidable."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip08_90\".m_mContent: "I told you these tricks won't work against... Wha?!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_02\".m_mContent: "In my homeland, we call this a 'medical book'... Want to look at it with me?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_03\".m_mContent: "We'll surely find it, won't we? A way to stop 'Death.'"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_04\".m_mContent: "When the time comes, we'll return here together."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_10\".m_mContent: "What's going on... Piera, why'd you hit me?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_11\".m_mContent: "You were just lying there, completely still. I was afraid something happened to you."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_12\".m_mContent: "Well as long as you're okay, then don't mind me."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_13\".m_mContent: "My head is a mess... Did I just fall off a cliff? Why do I have a sense of déjà vu?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_14\".m_mContent: "Oh, I can't believe you're still in one piece after falling from all the way up there!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_15\".m_mContent: "Piera... you seem more upbeat than usual. Is it because we got away from Death?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_16\".m_mContent: "No... it's not that easy. We were fooled. What we saw wasn't Death's true form."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_17\".m_mContent: "Of course... That explains why another one appeared out of nowhere."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_18\".m_mContent: "If I hadn't acted quickly... But never mind that, you should go find your companions!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_20\".m_mContent: "I have. One of them said she was heading to the village and would wait for you there."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_21\".m_mContent: "Was it Aiona? That sounds like her."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_22\".m_mContent: "...Hmm? Piera, I just noticed... that thing you had on your back... where did it go?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_23\".m_mContent: "Oh, I accidentally lost it while I was searching for you on the mountainside."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_25\".m_mContent: "You nearly lost your life trying to help me. Nothing could be more important than finding you safe and sound."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_27\".m_mContent: "You can thank me later. Right now we need to get to the village!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_28\".m_mContent: "Um, well... isn't the village at the base of the mountain? Shouldn't we be heading the other way?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_29\".m_mContent: "I got the directions wrong again? I'm so embarrassed!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_32\".m_mContent: "By why does that name sound so familiar...?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_33\".m_mContent: "Piera? Noah! You've finally come to rescue me!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_34\".m_mContent: "Where's Sora? Weren't you two looking for the doctor together? Where is he?!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_35\".m_mContent: "We... we searched everywhere, but couldn't find the doctor... Sora, he... he didn't make it..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_36\".m_mContent: "Did he... turn into a Blood Beast?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_37\".m_mContent: "Damn it! Damn the Black Blood! Why does it keep tormenting us?!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_38\".m_mContent: "So the wild boars on the island... are the natives who have succumbed to Black Blood?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_39\".m_mContent: "It's all our fault... If only we had believed the doctor's diagnosis sooner... if only I had sought help from the Church in time..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_40\".m_mContent: "Piera... you contacted the Church? When did you...?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_41\".m_mContent: "Sora, I won't let you suffer alone..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_42\".m_mContent: "After I end your pain, I'll join you!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_43\".m_mContent: "Jason! Have you lost your mind?! That's a Blood Beast!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_46\".m_mContent: "Just let me handle it. You're afraid of beasts, right?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_47\".m_mContent: "Sora isn't a...! He's a living, breathing person!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_48\".m_mContent: "Sora... You're not giving up like this, are you? Losing to that Noah Nevernight..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_50\".m_mContent: "...Hah, look at you now... What a sorry sight..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_51\".m_mContent: "...But I couldn't win either, this last battle..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_55\".m_mContent: "We must go to the village. We need to find the doctor as soon as possible."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_57\".m_mContent: "Noah, are you listening? The Black Blood disease on the island has spiraled beyond you and the doctor's control."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_58\".m_mContent: "There may be even more tragedies along the way. We can't afford to waste time here."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip09_59\".m_mContent: "But I want to see if they will..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_01\".m_mContent: "Odd... we should have reached it by now. The village wasn't this far away."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_02\".m_mContent: "...I recall you saying the village was at the base of the mountain, but we've been subtly veering off the right path this whole time..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_05\".m_mContent: "No way... How do I keep getting lost on my own doorstep?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_06\".m_mContent: "Guess you've always been bad with directions..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_07\".m_mContent: "Don't give me that look... E-Everyone loses their bearings at some point, right?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_08\".m_mContent: "D-Don't suddenly get quiet like you're trying to spare my feelings!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_09\".m_mContent: "No, I was just thinking how you remind me of my other companions. I suppose I can see where you're coming from."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_11\".m_mContent: "What's wrong? Hey, look, I won't think any less of you because of this little 'flaw.'"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_12\".m_mContent: "It's not that... I just realized... I might have done something bad."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_13\".m_mContent: "When the people from the Church landed on the island, I... I think I gave them the wrong directions."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_14\".m_mContent: "Did I send them to the other side of the island? No wonder we haven't seen any signs of rescue!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_15\".m_mContent: "You contacted the Church and brought them here? Why didn't you tell me about this before?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_16\".m_mContent: "Well, you and the doctor have always been against involving the Church in the island's affairs. You wanted to handle things yourselves..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_18\".m_mContent: "But with everything that's been happening on the island recently, I couldn't bear to watch everyone getting infected and turning into beasts one after another. That's why the village chief and I contacted the Church..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_19\".m_mContent: "The people from the Church—how many of them were there?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_20\".m_mContent: "Not many, but they were all wearing masks like some kind of elite squad."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_21\".m_mContent: "After hearing our plea, the Church took it very seriously. They even sent a Bell Ringer to handle the matter."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_22\".m_mContent: "A Bell Ringer?! Are you saying a Bell Ringer has come to this island again? Just like what happened 66 years ago?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_23\".m_mContent: "66 years ago? What are you talking about...?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_25\".m_mContent: "Could it be Death that I encountered on the cliff? And their presence at both ends..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_26\".m_mContent: "No, these are not Death... They're phantoms of longing that it has corrupted."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_28\".m_mContent: "An odd fellow from the Church told me, but more importantly..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_30\".m_mContent: "Why do you look so frightened? Did my outburst startle you?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_32\".m_mContent: "Yes. You see, the phantoms had already existed on the island, but they never harmed anyone. It was only after being corrupted by Death that they turned into these nightmares."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_33\".m_mContent: "The source of their mutation is Black Blood—and salt is one of the substances that counteracts Black Blood!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_34\".m_mContent: "So things that have been corrupted by Black Blood are weak to salt..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_35\".m_mContent: "That's right! I've also heard that each of the Church's twelve Bell Ringers possesses a unique ability that specifically counters Black Blood!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_36\".m_mContent: "Your salt seems to be working, but it doesn't look that effective."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_37\".m_mContent: "Well, I've only just learned how to use it. Once I fully master its secrets, I'll rid this island of all the nightmares."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_38\".m_mContent: "Then I'd better stay alive to witness the day you unleash the secrets of salt!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_39\".m_mContent: "Even though the salt weakened the nightmares, you're actually..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_40\".m_mContent: "...Quite the fighter! Have you been hiding your strength this whole time?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_41\".m_mContent: "What's that supposed to mean? Sure, we're just a tiny village on some far-flung island, but I'm still the Captain of the Guard, you know!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_43\".m_mContent: "But Noah... when did you become so strong? All this time, we thought you were just some frail assistant to the doctor..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_44\".m_mContent: "It looks like we have mistaken one another from the start."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_45\".m_mContent: "What do you mean? I'm never been mistaken about a person! You're Noah, plain and simple! Even if you started acting like a completely different person..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_46\".m_mContent: "The truth is, I'm not the Noah you think you know. And you... you're not the Piera I know either, right?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_47\".m_mContent: "Wh-what are you saying?! If you're not Noah, then who are you?! And if I'm not Piera, then who do you think I am?!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_48\".m_mContent: "You've already known for a long time, haven't you?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_49\".m_mContent: "Living on Sunset Isle, you should know better than me..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip10_50\".m_mContent: "Just like the nightmare we encountered, one of us..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_01\".m_mContent: "What? One of us is a phantom?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_02\".m_mContent: "That's ridiculous! Wouldn't we know if we were a phantom?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_03\".m_mContent: "In truth, no one knows what happens after we die. Perhaps its possible to become a phantom of longing thoughts."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_04\".m_mContent: "I believe neither of us has been the subject of someone else's longing."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_05\".m_mContent: "Of course! Everyone on the island knows that phantoms can only manifest from those we've shared wonderful memories with..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_06\".m_mContent: "But before the Black Blood outbreak, very few people actually encountered them... It's not like we could ask them, 'Hey, do you know you're just a memory of someone's longing?'"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_07\".m_mContent: "Maybe you're really not the Noah I knew... How could you be so cold and doubt me!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_08\".m_mContent: "No, I'm not just doubting you, I'm doubting my own existence as well."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_09\".m_mContent: "To be honest, ever since I woke up on this island, I've been experiencing a sense of surreal confusion..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_10\".m_mContent: "Are you suggesting you might be a phantom I created?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_11\".m_mContent: "But Noah, for someone to become a phantom, doesn't that mean they've died?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_12\".m_mContent: "I don't remember dying... Do you, Noah?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_13\".m_mContent: "Even though I lost my memories, it feels like I've been constantly having brushes with death these past few days."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_15\".m_mContent: "Piera, when you were talking about your grandmother, you asked if I was a phantom or a real, living person, right?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_17\".m_mContent: "I'm saying, now that I think about it, aren't I more likely to be the longings of the dead?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_18\".m_mContent: "No, I mean about my grandmother. She sacrificed herself as a Gravekeeper before I was even born. I've never met her, nor have I ever mentioned her to you."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_19\".m_mContent: "What?! But you're the one who told me about her today, when we first met..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_20\".m_mContent: "Today? When we first met? There's something seriously wrong with you, Noah."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_22\".m_mContent: "Jason, Sora, and I, along with you and Dr. Ressa, have been living together on this island for many years now."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_23\".m_mContent: "How could that be? Jason... Sora... Ressa... Why can't I remember any of them...?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_24\".m_mContent: "Am I just a phantom of the deceased? Who am I really?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_25\".m_mContent: "No... While I have no memories of the past, my experiences with Empousa and the others since my rebirth must be real..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_26\".m_mContent: "No, I refuse to accept that I'm merely someone's memory of longing. But if I'm not a phantom, and neither are you, Piera, then..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_29\".m_mContent: "It's coming from the village! Did something happen there?!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_30\".m_mContent: "So many nightmares... were all destroyed? Who could have done this?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_30a\".m_mContent: "The remains of these nightmares didn't disappear... they've crystallized into fragments. Is this... salt?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_31\".m_mContent: "'The blood before us is the guidance left by our forebears; the shadow behind us is the resolve set for our descendants...'"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_33\".m_mContent: "What's going on? The tremors seem to be coming from the mountain!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_34\".m_mContent: "It's the blessed grounds... at the top of the mountain! We must hurry! Someone is reciting—"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_35\".m_mContent: "—The chant of my family's forbidden ritual! It turns the invoker into a 'sacrifice,' reducing them to nothing but ashes!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_36\".m_mContent: "Looks like they're not going to let us go up without a fight."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_38\".m_mContent: "Who could it be? Only those from the Paracelsus bloodline can become the sacrifice..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_39\".m_mContent: "...That forbidden ritual should have been forgotten ages ago. No one but me should know about it. Who... who could it be?!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_40\".m_mContent: "Well whoever you are, I won't let you throw your life away like this!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_41\".m_mContent: "...In the name of Paracelsuses... I offer forth this life as sacrifice to the legacy...'"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip11_45\".m_mContent: "Noah? I'm glad you're okay... And the person you brought with you..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_01\".m_mContent: "Noah... I must go... go and save him!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_06\".m_mContent: "I am Piera... Piera Paracelsus... the last Gravekeeper of the Paracelsus family."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_07\".m_mContent: "Grandmother... taught me to have determination. Noah... put his trust in me. Standing against you, I am no longer alone..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_08\".m_mContent: "Noah... Was it really just a coincidence that you used this gesture as our secret signal...?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_09\".m_mContent: "Even though Master said I can't fully control this power... if I use it with this..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_11\".m_mContent: "I would strongly advise against opening that coffin."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_12\".m_mContent: "You're not ready to use Covenant just yet."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_14\".m_mContent: "Ugh, what a pain. These minions of Death can barely string two words together, yet they won't shut up."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_16\".m_mContent: "Without following their loud racket, you'd still be lost, wandering the island."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_17\".m_mContent: "You're even more annoying than them! I would never get lost on this pebble of an island, unlike that old hag!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_19\".m_mContent: "How did I know you were here? And why would I come after you personally just for leaving the Church without permission, right?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_20\".m_mContent: "There are only two situations that require a Bell Ringer to personally take action: one is to 'cleanse' a Black Blood outbreak, and the other..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_21\".m_mContent: "...Is to deal with traitors who blaspheme against the Church and its mission."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_22\".m_mContent: "You should understand this better than anyone else in this world. Yet you still did it... Why did it have to be you..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_23\".m_mContent: "Piera Paracelsus, Vice-Commander of the Third Bell Ringer."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_24\".m_mContent: "No... I didn't... Acappella, listen to me, I can explain!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_25\".m_mContent: "Save your excuses for your master, Albrecht, that old fossil."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_26\".m_mContent: "Does Master... suspect me as well? Was he.. disappointed?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_27\".m_mContent: "Who knows? That old geezer always acts like nothing ever concerns him. No one knows if he cares about anything. However..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_28\".m_mContent: "This time, his Vice-Commander has committed such a serious crime, even someone like him couldn't just feign indifference."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_29\".m_mContent: "Ah! Does this mean we'll finally see him without that annoying grin? I'm getting more excited by the second!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_30\".m_mContent: "I find that rather difficult to envision."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_31\".m_mContent: "No, it was all my doing! Master had absolutely nothing to do with this!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_32\".m_mContent: "I haven't even said what your crime was. Aren't you getting ahead of yourself?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_33\".m_mContent: "Because you know something, right? Or maybe you did do it after all."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_35\".m_mContent: "Piera, tell me, how much do you really know?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_37\".m_mContent: "I watched you grow up! I don't want you to die! Don't you understand? I'm asking you one last time..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_38\".m_mContent: "Did you help Death escape from the cathedral?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_40\".m_mContent: "You've been chasing her with me all this time, and you still haven't figured that out?!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_41\".m_mContent: "But didn't you say that only Bell Ringers have access to that part of the cathedral?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_42\".m_mContent: "Isn't a Vice-Commander always with their Bell Ringer when on duty? ...Just like you, idiot."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_44\".m_mContent: "Hold on, are you saying I'm a suspect too?!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_45\".m_mContent: "If you didn't do it, then why did you just happen to secretly leave the Church on the exact same day Death escaped? And why..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_46\".m_mContent: "...did you come straight back to Sunset Isle?! It lines up perfectly with our observation of Death's movements..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_47\".m_mContent: "Because... I knew... I knew that Death escaped, and I also knew it would return here..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_48\".m_mContent: "You expect me to believe that? If it wasn't you, how could you possibly know all this?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_49\".m_mContent: "I... I just know! I know... Death will return. I know how to deal with it, and I also know..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_50\".m_mContent: "I had to come back here. It must be me... who puts an end to Death. Because I am..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_51\".m_mContent: "The last Gravekeeper of the Paracelsus family. This is my destiny and duty."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_52\".m_mContent: "What nonsense are you spouting! You're about to lose your life, and you're talking about duty?!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_53\".m_mContent: "Yet... I can't detect even a hint of hesitation in your heartbeat... Are you actually serious?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_54\".m_mContent: "You think you can really handle Death? That's a 'Calamity'! What could a pathetic excuse for a Vice-Commander like you possibly do?!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_55\".m_mContent: "Let's be wildly generous and say you actually learned Death's weakness from that old woman. What difference would it even make?!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_56\".m_mContent: "Do you really think you'll come out of this unscathed? Can you escape the Church's penalty? How will you... even stay alive?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_57\".m_mContent: "Thank you, Acappella. The fact that you're saying all this... it means you've believed in my innocence all along, doesn't it?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_59\".m_mContent: "What do you mean 'that's enough'?! I can hear your heartbeat—you're terrified!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_60\".m_mContent: "You're just a stammering coward, just a weakling who gets winded from singing a single song, just..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_61\".m_mContent: "A mere child who just turned twenty right under my nose... Why... Why are you suddenly taller than me? Why..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_62\".m_mContent: "Why do you have the same look in your eyes as that old woman? Why is everyone abandoning me?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_64\".m_mContent: "Plus, there are always plenty of 'new friends' eager to meet you."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_65\".m_mContent: "Acappella... I know you still have many questions... but these... could they be Death's... minions? They..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_66\".m_mContent: "Darcias, I don't want to obliterate this entire island just yet, but I really need to vent my anger, so—"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_67\".m_mContent: "I'll count to thirty, and if these vexing vermin are still alive..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_72\".m_mContent: "Twenty-one. Never underestimate a Bell Ringer's sense of time."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_73\".m_mContent: "That last sec was for my catchphrase."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_74\".m_mContent: "Couldn't live up to your own boast, huh? Get ready for a scolding when we're back at the Church."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_75\".m_mContent: "Wow... so Darcias is that skilled too..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_76\".m_mContent: "Dealing with Death's minions? It's nothing special."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_77\".m_mContent: "Meanwhile, I... I can't even handle one on my own..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_78\".m_mContent: "Piera... have you ever wondered why the Bell Ringer's Vice-Commanders tend to be such emotionally detached oddballs?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_79\".m_mContent: "Well... my teacher never really talks about... what he does as the Bell Ringer..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_80\".m_mContent: "The thing is, when the Bell Ringer goes all out in battle, survival within a hundred-mile radius is nearly impossible. That's why they require such individuals as Vice-Commanders—"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_81\".m_mContent: "They possess an innate battle instinct and are devoid of fear—in essence, they are perfect war machines."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_82\".m_mContent: "Is it truly appropriate to speak of someone in such a manner when they're present?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_83\".m_mContent: "But if that's the case... why would Master choose me? I'm not good in battle and I don't have any special abilities... I'm not good at anything..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_84\".m_mContent: "That old man may be a bit of a scoundrel, but he doesn't make meaningless choices. You have your own worth."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_85\".m_mContent: "You're different from Darcias. You're not a cold weapon; you have your own thoughts, your own emotions..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_86\".m_mContent: "Could it be that she... actually hates me?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_87\".m_mContent: "Although you're very timid and weak, likely incapable of accomplishing anything on your own..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_88\".m_mContent: "It's fine. It seems she holds everyone in equal contempt."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_89\".m_mContent: "You... you're just making me more confused! Everyone else is like some myth or superhuman, while I'm just... a useless nobody..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_90\".m_mContent: "You are indeed just a 'useless' mortal. You fear danger, you die when wounded... But you're far from ordinary!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_91\".m_mContent: "Even when afraid, you didn't back down; knowing you could die, you never even considered giving up. You possess something we don't..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_92\".m_mContent: "The resolve to challenge predetermined fate with a fragile form; the courage to pursue one's own will in the face of cruel reality, that is—"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_94\".m_mContent: "So, Acappella... you knew what I'd choose all along, didn't you? Yet you kept testing me..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_95\".m_mContent: "I am indeed angry at you for leaving the Church on your own without consulting me; but I'm also angry at myself..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_96\".m_mContent: "At this point, I'm powerless to alter the Inquisition's verdict against you, let alone influence whatever you intend to do next."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_97\".m_mContent: "So, do we report back and say we never saw her on the island?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_98\".m_mContent: "Whether we bring her back, what happens afterwards... we'll cross those bridges when she actually returns."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_99\".m_mContent: "For now, let's concentrate on how we can help Piera with the time we have left on the island."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_100\".m_mContent: "Acappella, are you saying... you'll help me fight against Death? That's wonderful! With you by my side..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_101\".m_mContent: "Don't get your hopes up. Albrecht must have told you that the Bell Ringers are not allowed to interfere too much with the 'predetermined future'..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_102\".m_mContent: "This is about your family's duty and finding yourself. In the end, you must face it alone."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_103\".m_mContent: "After losing your temper, you're back to acting like a Bell Ringer."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_104\".m_mContent: "...I understand now. I've made my decision. I used to believe I was all alone, that no one needed me..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_105\".m_mContent: "But in truth, Grandmother and you, Acappella, have always been protecting me. As well as Master, and even Noah, whom I just met today..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_106\".m_mContent: "Noah! I almost forgot he was knocked off the cliff by Death's minions! I have to save him!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_107\".m_mContent: "...Did you just say Noah? It couldn't be..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip12_108\".m_mContent: "That guy with silver hair?! He's on this island as well?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_01\".m_mContent: "Silver hair... You know Noah too, Acappella?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_02\".m_mContent: "...You could say we were shipmates for a while, searching for Sunset Isle."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_03\".m_mContent: "Though he was a passenger, while we were stowaways."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_04\".m_mContent: "Hey Darcias, the ship went down pretty fast after I took out that Famine, didn't it?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_05\".m_mContent: "That's right. Your use of Covenant not only defeated Famine but also destroyed the ship."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_06\".m_mContent: "Wait, are you saying this is my fault? I made sure to evacuate all the survivors from the deck to the other side of the island!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_07\".m_mContent: "Come to think of it, that silver-haired guy wasn't on the deck when all this went down, was he?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_09\".m_mContent: "Then he must have made it to the island by himself... but was it before or after the ship went down?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_10\".m_mContent: "Hold on... Sunset Isle is home to the Head of the Divine Body, the piece with the most free will."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_11\".m_mContent: "The 'Head'... Does that mean the Church... knows the appearance and whereabouts of every Divine Body?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_13\".m_mContent: "Throughout the ages, this isle has stood apart, its shores barred to outsiders by the will of the Divine Body. Thus it has ascended into the realm of legend."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_14\".m_mContent: "But how did Noah reach these shores? Could there be a way even a Bell Ringer doesn't know about?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_15\".m_mContent: "If the Divine Body rejects all outsiders to this island... could it be that Noah is, in fact, not an outsider?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_17\".m_mContent: "If memory serves, he said even without his memories, he was somehow certain that this island was his homeland..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_20\".m_mContent: "Ah... Could it be... I see now... That's why Noah was so flustered back then..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_21\".m_mContent: "You've figured it out too, haven't you, Piera?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_22\".m_mContent: "I don't get it. What are you two talking about?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_23\".m_mContent: "And you were there with us 66 years ago to subjugate Death. Don't tell me you've forgotten...?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_24\".m_mContent: "In that great battle, we sealed Death at the cost of losing our commander, then brought the survivors from the island back to the Church."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_25\".m_mContent: "From that moment, the 'shades of longing' created by the Head of the Divine Body became the sole inhabitants of the island. Not a single living being remained."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_26\".m_mContent: "I recall, but what does it have to do with Noah?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_27\".m_mContent: "The question is... if Noah... if he's actually from here, then... when was he born?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_29\".m_mContent: "Do you really think he looks that old?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_30\".m_mContent: "But in these 66 years, the three of us haven't aged either."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_31\".m_mContent: "I'm a Bell Ringer, and you're a 'weapon' that can just swap to a new body, idiot. As for Piera..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_32\".m_mContent: "She's not the Piera from 66 years ago! She's the granddaughter of that old hag—of that person!"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_34\".m_mContent: "I simply assumed because you have the same name. I apologize, Piera."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_35\".m_mContent: "Don't worry, Darcias... You've been treating me like my grandmother... I guess that means I'm very similar to her... That makes me happy."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_36\".m_mContent: "What about the silver-haired guy? Why hasn't he aged? He's clearly not from the Church... so who exactly is he?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_38\".m_mContent: "Come to think of it, wasn't there someone from the Bathory family on the ship too? Could that have been his companion?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_39\".m_mContent: "Bathory? I think grandmother mentioned them... Are they also Gravekeepers of the Divine Body like my family?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_41\".m_mContent: "But the Bathorys turned to the Calamity in their obsession for 'eternal life.' As a result, they were destroyed by the Church."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_42\".m_mContent: "Of course, they weren't completely destroyed... Rumor was that they managed to achieve some form of 'eternal life' and now live in seclusion, adhering to the First Tenet of Secrecy."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_43\".m_mContent: "So Noah... might be connected to the Bathory family... Could the companions he's searching for also be...?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_44\".m_mContent: "If he's really connected to the Bathorys, or any Bloodborn who follow the Calamities, it would explain everything."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_45\".m_mContent: "There's also a worst-case scenario... Could he be..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_47\".m_mContent: "No, it's nothing. Anyway, you mentioned he fell off a cliff, right? Even if he's a Bloodborn, he's not truly immortal. Shouldn't you go save him?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_48\".m_mContent: "Oh, you're right! But... where should I even start looking?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_49\".m_mContent: "Leave it to me, then. I can track him down."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_51\".m_mContent: "I told you, I won't stand in your way, nor will I take part in your mission. But for everything else, I can help."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_52\".m_mContent: "No... what I mean is... Noah might be a Bloodborn... an enemy of the Church. I don't want you to harm him..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_53\".m_mContent: "So you're worried about him. Well don't. If he really is from Sunset Isle 66 years ago, we might just have a lot in common..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_54\".m_mContent: "Maybe he knew the old hag... I mean your grandmother. Or perhaps he even knew the commander. Maybe we even know each other."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_55\".m_mContent: "I trust you, Acappella, but you've only met him once. How do you plan to find him?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_56\".m_mContent: "Did you forget that I'm the 10th Bell Ringer and commander of The Choir?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_57\".m_mContent: "I can hear every living heartbeat on this island! How do you think I managed to find you?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_58\".m_mContent: "But that didn't prevent you from getting lost on the way here."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_59\".m_mContent: "Acappella... thank you. I know you can read hearts, so you can already tell... of my fear... and apprehension..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_60\".m_mContent: "When I first arrived on this island, I knew I wasn't prepared... I wanted to run away... But Noah..."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_61\".m_mContent: "It was his presence... he gave me the strength to face my destiny."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_62\".m_mContent: "Your heartbeat has calmed down. I can sense the courage you two give each other."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_63\".m_mContent: "Go, follow your path. I'll help you find him, so he can be your ally in the fight against the Calamity's fate."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_64\".m_mContent: "Acappella... will you promise... to help Noah escape?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_65\".m_mContent: "I will. But in return, you must promise not to open that coffin before I come back."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_68\".m_mContent: "Forgive me, Acappella. I fear I can't keep my promise."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_69\".m_mContent: "I fear I can't keep my promise."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_70\".m_mContent: "You're not going to tell her? The possibility that troubles you so?"

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_71\".m_mContent: "Should the true identity of this Noah align with my fears, it would be too much for that child."

\"Dialogue_B_80001_Clip13_72\".m_mContent: "And should that one-in-a-million scenario come to pass, I'll be compelled to act—with such extremity that no one around me will be safe."
