They returned half a year later, with various degrees of damage to their bodily functions. If you ask me, we should forget about this whole idea!"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_105_01\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on 'sending vassals to explore the island of the 'Other Side' despite the risks involved?'"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_106_01\".m_mContent: "Recently, the Church has been mining meteor craters day and night at the Howling Peninsula, yet these 'meteors' appear no different from ordinary stones. What are your thoughts on whether we should investigate the Church's true motives?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_106_01.m_mContent: "These meteor fragments look completely unremarkable, and according to our family's senior alchemist, they cannot be refined into anything useful."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_106_02.m_mContent: "For stones with absolutely no practical value, the Church is willing to sacrifice numerous soldiers to mine them... This is too suspicious. We should send people to investigate."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_106_01.m_mContent: "Wait, wait! Those mining sites are guarded by clergy members with formidable Blood Power! Going there rashly will surely lead to direct conflict. Our limited number of vassals will be captured before we can even uncover the truth. I say we should abandon this plan!"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_106_01\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on 'investigating the Church's true reasons for mining the meteorites, despite the risks involved'?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_107_01\".m_mContent: "A vassal who traveled to the Alita family returned with an album of secret alchemical techniques, but even our family's senior alchemist cannot decipher the formulas depicted within. Should we proceed with further research?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_107_01.m_mContent: "I've noticed that even the alchemical ingredients they use are quite unusual. Things like mistletoe, beryl..."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_107_02.m_mContent: "It's a completely new system of alchemy. If we invest a bit more time in studying it, we might stumble upon some unexpected breakthroughs."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_107_01.m_mContent: "Too young, too imprudent. Experimenting with alchemical formulas they barely comprehend... One misstep and they'll face the dire consequences of their own folly."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_107_02.m_mContent: "Furthermore, we have but a handful of alchemists in the castle. To assign them to study that worthless tome would be to neglect our 'real work'! We'd best set it aside for now."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_107_01\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on 'expanding alchemy research to combat 'emerging' factions'?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_108_01\".m_mContent: "Some vassals are very curious about the alchemical research Cain has been conducting in secret, and they hope he could share some of his findings with everyone. What are your thoughts on this matter?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_108_01.m_mContent: "Come to think of it, why doesn't Cain ever collaborate with other alchemists in his research?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_108_02.m_mContent: "Moreover, the Bathory steward often appears and disappears mysteriously, and his words are always cryptic. We should investigate what he's really up to."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_108_01.m_mContent: "Recreating vassals and preparing for the 'return to the moon' are all thanks to Cain's efforts. You probably have no idea how much he has contributed to reviving the Bathory family's bloodline."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_108_02.m_mContent: "Furthermore, he never used family funds for his research. What right do you have to criticize him? Continue with your research, old friend. That is your prerogative."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_108_01\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on 'continuing to support Cain's unknown alchemical research'?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_109_01\".m_mContent: "The Third Tenet of the Bathory family is the 'Prohibition of Unsanctioned Creation of Progeny.' Vassals must obtain an Elder's consent to form blood contracts with outsiders. What are your thoughts on this matter?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_109_01.m_mContent: "Isn't that too severe? Preserving progeny is crucial for the family's revival. Why don't we reduce the severity of punishments? For instance, we could remove 'Exile' and 'Execution' as options."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_109_01.m_mContent: "On the contrary! It is precisely because our family's Bloodline is declining that we must ensure the purity of our vassals' lineage! In my opinion, elders should have absolute authority over newly created Bloodborn."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_109_01\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on 'reducing the severity of punishments for violating the Third Tenet: Unsanctioned Creation of Progeny'?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_110_01\".m_mContent: "The First Tenet of Secrecy is fundamental to the Bathory family. According to our history, this Tenet was established during the decline of the Bathory family. Is it still relevant in our current times?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_110_01.m_mContent: "To restore our family’s glory and conquer the continent, our Vassals must venture forth and gain worldly knowledge. We need only ensure they exercise discretion in their affairs."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_110_02.m_mContent: "The First Tenet of Secrecy is a relic of the past. We should have abolished such outdated nonsense long ago."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_110_01.m_mContent: "The young are quick to judge what they scarcely understand. Though the First Tenet of Secrecy was indeed established during the Bathory's decline, its true purpose is to ensure the utmost preservation of our bloodline."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_110_02.m_mContent: "Though we may be experiencing a resurgence, we remain vulnerable. Venturing out carelessly could draw the attention of Bloodborn hunters, endangering our family. In my view, under no circumstances should the Tenet be abolished."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_110_01\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on 'continuing to uphold the principle of the First Tenet of Secrecy'?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_111_01\".m_mContent: "A vassal returning from their travels has discovered an unclaimed land in the center of the continent. It's surrounded by mountains on three sides, forming a natural shelter. Should we claim it?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_111_01.m_mContent: "Not only is this place surrounded by mountains on three sides, but there's also a river on the east side flowing towards The Howling Peninsula. Anyone traveling by water must pass through here. It's a perfect haven."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_111_02.m_mContent: "The area is also rich in timber and stone, essential materials for building. Why hesitate over such a prime location? Let's claim it right away!"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_111_01.m_mContent: "Hold on, hold on. I've learned that this chamber is located at the border between the Ganelon and Carrelle territories. Although its position is secluded, there's still a risk of it being seized."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_111_02.m_mContent: "Moreover, this place is far from our castle. If we were to claim it, we'd need to send some of our few Vassals to guard it. In my opinion, we should focus on repairing our castle before considering expansion."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_111_01\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on 'claiming this area with favorable natural conditions but far from our castle'?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_112_01\".m_mContent: "We’ve received several anonymous letters suggesting that some of the Elders’ decision-making power be delegated to the Vassals. What are your thoughts on this proposal?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_112_01.m_mContent: "Absolutely support it! From major decisions like the power to execute vassals and the right to use high-level Alchemy, to minor ones like daily menu planning and choosing the castle's furniture style... the elders want to control everything!"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_112_02.m_mContent: "It's about time we give them a break. For all these trivial matters, why not let the vassals vote and decide?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_112_01.m_mContent: "The elders rack their brains night after night for the future of our family. And now, they're expected to let a bunch of brats decide how well-done their steaks should be and how soft their beds are..."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_112_02.m_mContent: "In my humble opinion, we should respect tradition and allow the Elders to preside over all matters. In doing so, we safeguard their honor and preserve the dignity befitting their esteemed status."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_112_01\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on 'reducing the scope of authority of our elders'?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_113_01\".m_mContent: "The castle messengers report frequent correspondence from the Roland family. While there's no formal rule against Vassals communicating with other families, the frequency of these exchanges is concerning."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_113_02\".m_mContent: "To protect the family's interests, some elders are considering convicting those involved. I'd like to hear everyone's thoughts on this matter."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_113_01.m_mContent: "Let me speak up for the person in question! The one sending letters is an old acquaintance from before they joined the Bloodborn. Although an outsider, they bear no ill will towards the Bloodborn."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_113_02.m_mContent: "I can attest that their interactions are strictly on a personal level... Don't ask how I know! In any case, there's no need for concern, and conviction is absolutely unnecessary."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_113_01.m_mContent: "The young think far too simplistically. Allow me to speak on behalf of the Elders: Though the family shows signs of rising prominence, we must remain cautious and maintain a prudent distance from the Kingdom and the Church."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_113_02.m_mContent: "Especially with factions like the Roland family, whose close ties to the Church pose a significant risk—we must avoid excessive contact, lest those with ulterior motives infiltrate our ranks. The Elders condemn a Vassal not just as a punishment, but also as a calculated warning."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_113_01\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on 'convicting vassals who have close associations with the kingdom'?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_114_01\".m_mContent: "The Church has purged all those infected with the Plague in Mouret. In the northern part of the Lupine Forest, descendants of the Ganelon family's collateral branches still maintain their guard."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_114_02\".m_mContent: "This would be an opportune time to propose a merger treaty, but given the generations of hostility between the Bathory and them, the method of approach requires careful consideration..."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_114_01.m_mContent: "These Ganelon people have lost their families and leaders. They're in a precarious situation where they could be purged by the Church at any moment. Now is precisely when they need protection."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_114_02.m_mContent: "We could first dispatch Vassals to initiate diplomatic talks and convey our willingness to offer protection. They may submit to us unconditionally."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_114_01.m_mContent: "Hold on! Bathory Castle is no refuge for strays! As the Lord himself said, the Bathory and Ganelon families have been sworn enemies for generations—how could we possibly take their descendants as our Vassals?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_114_02.m_mContent: "I say we execute these scattered Ganelon descendants at once and seize their territory. There is no room for negotiation with Werewolves!"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_114_01\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on 'signing a peace and merger treaty with the declining Ganelon family'?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_115_01\".m_mContent: "Our vassal infiltrating the Cidhall family's territory has sent word that there may be another Bloodborn faction on the continent. Shall we conduct further investigation into this matter?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_115_01.m_mContent: "Word on the street is that this Bloodborn faction differs greatly from the Bathory—they live among humans, with similar eating habits and lifestyles."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_115_02.m_mContent: "Most importantly, they have abandoned the survival-of-the-fittest ideology and display remarkable friendliness toward fellow Bloodborn. Given how few of Black Blood lineage remain today, we should investigate their background thoroughly and seize this chance to forge an alliance."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_115_01.m_mContent: "How naive! Since the Holy War, the Church has all but eradicated Black Blood from the continent. The Bloodborn barely survived—another Bloodborn faction’s existence is impossible."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_115_02.m_mContent: "In my view, this report is more likely an elaborate trap, using Bathory's desire for Bloodborn revival as bait. We would be wise not to act rashly."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_115_01\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on 'exploring other Bloodborn factions on the continent'?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_116_01\".m_mContent: "We've found the rumored Bloodborn faction. Upon contact, we discovered they're quite friendly towards Bathory. Perhaps we could use this opportunity to propose an alliance. What do you all think?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_116_01.m_mContent: "Indeed, this is a good opportunity. Although they've made it clear they have no intention of getting involved in the conflict between the Bloodborn and the Church, they're quite generous in other aspects."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_116_02.m_mContent: "For instance, they've offered to provide sanctuary to Bathory's vassals whenever they need assistance abroad. I believe we should form a strategic alliance with them!"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_116_01.m_mContent: "No intention of getting involved? What a joke! I've never seen such cowardly Bloodborn! Bathory would never stoop so low as to ally with such a conservative and weak faction!"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_116_01\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on 'proposing an alliance with the conservative Bloodborn faction'?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_117_01\".m_mContent: "Cain predicts that the castle may face financial strain in the latter half of the year. Currently, most of the castle's funds come from taxes paid by vassals and believers. Should we consider raising taxes?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_117_01.m_mContent: "Raising taxes can only solve our immediate needs. In the long run, it's not a good solution and will inevitably cause discontent among vassals and believers. It's time we explore new ways to earn Soli and acquire resources!"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_117_01.m_mContent: "Developing trade routes takes time and resources, but that's a matter for later. The family is at a crucial stage of revival. Castle repairs, cultivating vassals, the 'Return to the Moon' project... everything requires Soli."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_117_02.m_mContent: "In my opinion, to ensure comfortable lives for all present here in the latter half of the year, we have no choice but to raise taxes for now."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_117_01\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on 'raising raxes to address our financial strain in the latter half of the year'?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_118_01\".m_mContent: "The border guards have sent word that a cartographer is requesting permission to survey the Bathory territory. It's said that the cartographers' guild has a long history, dedicated to recording historical events and surveying geographical areas with a neutral stance."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_118_02\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on granting them access?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_118_01.m_mContent: "Sounds like an impartial and highly professional organization. I say we let them survey our territory! They might help us learn more about our family history. I'm all for it!"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_118_01.m_mContent: "We must remain vigilant. The cartographers may claim neutrality, but persistent rumors suggest that several of its members frequently accept missions from the Church, operating in their service."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_118_02.m_mContent: "Allowing them entry so casually poses too great a risk. In my humble opinion, we ought to politely decline their request."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_118_01\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on 'allowing the self-proclaimed neutral cartographer to survey our territory'?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_119_01\".m_mContent: "Cain reports that we've received numerous complaints about the pricing at the Puppet Association's shop. What are your thoughts on imposing price controls?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_119_01.m_mContent: "We all know how bad-tempered Elder Bella's little puppets can be... If we impose price controls, they might just pack up and leave. What'll we do then?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_119_02.m_mContent: "Remember, the Puppet Association's shop is the only place in the castle where we can buy goods from the outside world. Lady Empousa's dolls, Elder Cidhall's wooden comb—they all come from there... We should cherish this one and only source of supplies."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_119_01.m_mContent: "I was the first to object when the Elder Baphomet decided to purchase armor from her. Now look where we are—not only are prices soaring, but the Puppet Association has monopolized all business in the castle. In my opinion, it's high time we take measures to regulate this situation."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_119_01\".m_mContent: "What are your views on 'imposing price controls to a certain degree on the shop'?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_120_01\".m_mContent: "Our family has always adhered to a 'family-first policy' in all matters. In our dealings with outsiders, this often makes us appear somewhat inflexible. What are your views on this matter?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_120_01.m_mContent: "I've been wanting to say this for a while now. Those elders always want to have the upper hand in everything, but in the end, we end up with no benefits at all."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_120_02.m_mContent: "At times, concessions and compromises can secure more enduring advantages. This is the art of negotiation! Let us cast aside antiquated notions and contemplate how to forge mutually beneficial alliances."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_120_01.m_mContent: "The younger generation fails to grasp the well-intentioned wisdom of their elders... 'Family-first' ensures survival in uncertain times, allowing our bloodline to endure."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_120_02.m_mContent: "Though the Bathory family is regaining its glory, we remain frail compared to the Kingdom and the Church. Only by prioritizing the family's benefit can we ensure our people thrive."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_120_01\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on 'adhering to family-first policy in all matters'?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_121_01\".m_mContent: "A senior Vassal has requested to enter the long sleep. This seems to be the first time a Vassal has voluntarily made such a choice. Should we grant their request?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_121_01.m_mContent: "A vassal tormented by illness and extreme mental fatigue cannot serve the family wholeheartedly. It would be better to let him return to Dracula's embrace."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_121_02.m_mContent: "Death is the destiny of humans, as the long sleep is the fate of the Bloodborn. The freedom to choose when to end one's existence should be his right."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_121_01.m_mContent: "I must disagree. Traditionally, decisions about a vassal's life and death have always been made by the lords and elders. Only when members suffer severe harm in battle or are sentenced to execution are they forced into the long sleep."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_121_02.m_mContent: "This policy is essential to preserving our family's power. If everyone is granted the freedom to take the long sleep, what will happen when war breaks out and they all choose death out of fear? Such a dangerous precedent must not be set under any circumstances."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_121_01\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on 'Granting vassals the freedom to enter the long sleep, provided there are sufficient grounds'?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_122_01\".m_mContent: "Allegedly, the Western Kingdom is planning to attack the Howling Peninsula. Although the authenticity of this information has yet to be verified, we should remain vigilant. Perhaps it's time to consider cultivating some reliable intelligence-gathering personnel. Do you agree?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_122_01.m_mContent: "I concur! Let us first train a select few and position them near the Ganelon territory, then gradually extend our influence across the continent."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_122_02.m_mContent: "Through this approach, we can establish Bathory’s intelligence network across all major kingdoms, gathering information from every corner of the realm!"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_122_01.m_mContent: "You're oversimplifying things! Most Vassals lack infiltration experience and would require specialized training. Moreover, infiltration carries the risk of exposure—we could lose the few exceptional Vassals we have."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_122_02.m_mContent: "Now is absolutely not the time to be training spies. In my opinion, we'd best hold off on this for now."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_122_01\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on arranging for vassals to infiltrate the territories of other Kingdoms?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_123_01\".m_mContent: "We've received a letter from a vassal expressing that the castle's menu is rather monotonous. They suggest adding appetizers, desserts, and beverages in addition to the main course. What are your thoughts on this matter?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_123_01.m_mContent: "Let me read Empou... oh, I mean, this vassal's letter: 'Every day it's Pure Blood Essence with raw pork chops. My taste buds are being trampled!'"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_123_02.m_mContent: "At the end of the letter, she attached her ideal menu—grilled beef with cheesy mashed sweet potatoes, mulled wine, and red velvet cake with raspberry jam. It sounds absolutely mouthwatering! Diversifying our menu is a must!"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_123_01.m_mContent: "Preposterous! The Bloodborn have no need for sustenance beyond blood. Gathering and preparing these frivolous ingredients not only wastes money and manpower but will also spoil our vassals with unnecessary indulgences."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_123_02.m_mContent: "In my opinion, we should keep the menu as it is. Let the younger generation taste the hardships we endured in our day!"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_123_01\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on 'investing a certain amount of money and manpower to diversify the castle's menu'?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_124_01\".m_mContent: "A Vassal has reported that the castle library has a limited variety of books and suggested we purchase some new genres. What are your thoughts on this matter?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_124_01.m_mContent: "I support this proposal! Our library currently only holds the following categories: family historical records, alchemy scrolls, manuals, and Dracula's philosophical works."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_124_02.m_mContent: "Lady Aiona has specifically compared our library with the one in her hometown. It seems we’re lacking books on continental history, literature and arts, and arithmetic and geometry. We should certainly consider acquiring new books!"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_124_01.m_mContent: "There was a time when our castle had a rich collection of books. After the Holy War and the family's decline, the former lord only kept the 'useful' books, while the 'useless' ones were buried in the abandoned cellars of the castle."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_124_02.m_mContent: "However, after all this time, most of the pages must have yellowed and wrinkled... Procuring new books isn't cheap. In my opinion, we should save our resources for now."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_124_01\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on 'investing certain manpower or funds to enrich the castle's book collection'?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_125_01\".m_mContent: "Several Vassals have reported that the daily evening meetings are inefficient and disrupt their regular sleep. They propose we discontinue them entirely. What do you think of this suggestion?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_125_01.m_mContent: "Exactly! These evening gatherings take up our precious night hours, and most of it is just idle chatter. Why not just use messenger bats or a bulletin board for urgent matters instead? Wouldn't that be far more efficient?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_125_01.m_mContent: "This matter must not be viewed in such a manner! The evening gatherings are a family tradition. The elders synchronize information, vassals interact with one another, all serving to bolster the family's cohesion."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_125_02.m_mContent: "In my view, the evening gatherings must not be abolished. These young ones, they merely wish to laze about in their coffins."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_125_01\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on 'canceling the castle's daily evening gatherings'?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_126_01\".m_mContent: "A vassal has secretly adopted a stray cat from near the castle. However, our family rules explicitly state that no pets other than Blood Servants are allowed. What are your thoughts on revoking this rule?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_126_01.m_mContent: "Untrained pets are entirely different from Blood Servants. Their lively and adorable nature can bring us much joy, breaking the monotony of our endless existence."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_126_02.m_mContent: "Consider this stray cat—not only is it affectionate and playful, but it also catches mice, making it far more endearing than that black cat perpetually dozing on the Elder’s chair. I propose we show more leniency and grant Vassals the freedom to keep pets."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_126_01.m_mContent: "You clearly don't understand the situation. This cat ran through the hallway and nearly caused my servant to spill an entire freshly brewed pot of pure blood tea!"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_126_02.m_mContent: "An untamed animal running wild in the castle could not only damage our antique furniture but also frighten our vassals. We absolutely cannot allow this! It's out of the question!"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_126_01\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on 'allowing vassals to keep pets other than Blood Servants'?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_127_01\".m_mContent: "Recently, a vassal has been frequently attending meetings in bat form, which seems to have caused dissatisfaction among other attendees. What are your thoughts on allowing vassals to attend meetings in transformed states?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_127_01.m_mContent: "Why is this even a question? Beast form is the very manifestation of the power of our blood. I believe we should encourage everyone to use beast form in meetings."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_127_02.m_mContent: "Moreover, by attending meetings in bat form, I not only avoid the hassle of formal attire but also save time to handle more important matters."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_127_01.m_mContent: "Attending meetings in human form is a basic sign of respect for important occasions. Just imagine how many would enjoy listening to reports while surrounded by shrill cries. Such foolishness is utterly unbecoming! In my view, it should be strictly forbidden!"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_127_01\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on 'allowing vassals to attend meetings in transformed states'?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_128_01\".m_mContent: "A Vassal has returned from their travels and shared insights on the noble education practices within the Alita family. What lessons, if any, should we take from their methods?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_128_02\".m_mContent: "Should we also provide similar education for our vassals? What are your thoughts on this?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_128_01.m_mContent: "A Bloodborn skilled only in Battle and lacking other talents will struggle to earn respect. I propose we establish all the arts, magic, and cultural education programs advocated by the Alita family!"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_128_01.m_mContent: "Implementing noble education isn't as simple as it sounds. It requires substantial financial and talent investment. If you ask me, teaching them magic will only lead to them burning down the castle, and teaching them painting will result in the castle walls being covered in graffiti."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_128_02.m_mContent: "What we need right now are practical skills and survival strategies. Instead of practicing singing, they should focus on perfecting techniques to precisely sever the major arteries of the Church's soldiers. Let's just forget about this."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_128_01\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on 'spending funds to promote upper class education in the castle'?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_129_01\".m_mContent: "The castle curtains show signs of being gnawed by rats, occasionally allowing sunlight to penetrate. Some vassals have suggested replacing them with wool tapestries for better light blocking, improving everyone's living conditions and sleep quality. What are your thoughts on this?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_129_01.m_mContent: "Of course we should change them! If light doesn't affect us, why not replace the ceiling with glass while we're at it?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_129_01.m_mContent: "I humbly disagree. The current curtains are sufficient for our needs. There is no reason to waste resources on this matter."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_129_02.m_mContent: "During the Holy War, we didn't even have houses. Who cared about curtains when we were sleeping in cellars? In my opinion, this expense is unnecessary."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_129_01\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on 'allocating funds to procure wool tapestries with superior light-blocking properties for curtains'?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_130_01\".m_mContent: "A Blood Servant has suggested purchasing a highly effective bloodstain cleaning agent developed by the Church. What are your thoughts on this matter?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_130_01.m_mContent: "I've tried it myself, and it truly works wonders. It's particularly effective for cleaning bloodstains on formal attire after hunts. We must have Elder Bella arrange an acquisition immediately!"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_130_01.m_mContent: "Preposterous! As Bloodborn, every drop of blood left from our hunts is a badge of honor."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_130_02.m_mContent: "Besides, what good could possibly come from anything made by the Church? If you ask me, we'd be better off saving our money!"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_130_01\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on 'purchasing the blood stain cleaner invented by the Church'?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Start_131_01\".m_mContent: "Recently, many vassals have experienced digestive discomfort from consuming raw meat. Perhaps we should reduce the supply of raw meat in the dining hall. What are your thoughts on this matter?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_PositiveState_131_01.m_mContent: "Consuming raw meat indeed increases the risk of disease transmission. I certainly don't wish to see everyone suffering from frequent stomach ailments. Let us partake in cooked fare instead!"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_131_01.m_mContent: "Preposterous! Consuming raw flesh and blood is not only a Bloodborn tradition, but it also infuses our bodies with an endless stream of vitality."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_NegativeState_131_02.m_mContent: "Cooking destroys the essence of blood. Would you have us adopt the digestive sensibilities of humans? In my view, we should steadfastly maintain the Bloodborn tradition of consuming raw sustenance."

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Question_131_01\".m_mContent: "What are your thoughts on 'prohibiting the consumption of raw flesh and blood'?"

\"CouncilHall_Issue_Turnpoint_02\".m_mContent: "What are the thoughts of those yet unheard?"

\"Tutorframe_405_01\".m_mContent: "The Bloodborn have their own tenets, just as pirates have their own code. Please read them carefully."

\"Tutorframe_405_02\".m_mContent: "Let's see what's written on the next page."

\"Tutorframe_405_03\".m_mContent: "Be careful! The traps on this ship are even more cunning than tricks from 'The Devil.'"

\"Tutorframe_405_04\".m_mContent: "Don't worry though, I've left hints in every stage. Feel free to check them when you lose your way."

\"Tutorframe_406_02\".m_mContent: "Tap the Round End button to finish."

\"Tutorframe_406_03\".m_mContent: "Tap a character card to select the character."

\"Tutorframe_407_01\".m_mContent: "Tap the Attack button. Let's see how far the scythe of 'Death' can reach."

\"Tutorframe_407_02\".m_mContent: "Tap the guard to select them as the target."

\"Tutorframe_407_03\".m_mContent: "The 'Wheel of Fortune' is about to turn. Tap Confirm to start the battle."

\"Tutorframe_408_01\".m_mContent: "Tap the Open button to open the chest."

\"Tutorframe_409_01\".m_mContent: "The chest is locked. It seems the 'Wheel of Fortune' has one more trial."

\"Tutorframe_410_01\".m_mContent: "The treasure chest lies just ahead. Let’s head out."

\"Tutorframe_410_02\".m_mContent: "Decoy is a highly deceptive skill that lures enemies to a designated location."

\"Tutorframe_410_04\".m_mContent: "Select a suitable tile to lead our friend astray."

\"Tutorframe_410_06\".m_mContent: "Good, let’s take a moment to rest and wait for our prey to walk into the web."

\"Tutor_406_01\".m_mContent: "Behold, a treasure chest awaits just beyond. Are you ready to embrace the challenge?"

\"Tutor_406_02\".m_mContent: "Oh dear... as expected, the iron law of 'Justice' has locked the door."

\"Tutor_406_03\".m_mContent: "Look over there. The mechanism's colors match the door, like two sides of the Lovers card."

\"Tutor_406_05\".m_mContent: "The key is within reach. Let's take a break."

\"Tutor_406_07\".m_mContent: "Eh? The chest is locked too? Well, well, seems the Church's enforcers have actually gotten smarter."

\"Tutor_406_08\".m_mContent: "Though putting a sleepyhead in charge of the key shows they've only gotten a tiny bit smarter."

\"Tutor_407_01\".m_mContent: "It's time to invoke the power of the 'Chariot' and deal with this sleeping guard."

\"Tutor_408_01\".m_mContent: "Hope I didn’t keep you waiting, Patchen. The key’s ours now."

\"Tutor_409_01\".m_mContent: "The chest is locked. It seems the 'Wheel of Fortune' has one more trial."

\"Tutor_409_02\".m_mContent: "The key’s with that sleepyhead over there. Take him out quickly."

\"Tutor_409_03\".m_mContent: "Take action and claim the fruits of victory!"

\"Tutor_410_01\".m_mContent: "Stop here—we're entering the guards' patrol route."

\"Tutor_410_02\".m_mContent: "Hmm... Looks like we'll need a touch of the Magician's craft to lure our diligent friend away from his post."

\"Tutor_410_03\".m_mContent: "My dear little Fool, you’ll be the one to stir up a bit of commotion and catch his attention."

\"Tutor_410_04\".m_mContent: "Behold, a lost lamb wanders right into our perfect trap. Now, we can move forward with the plan."

\"Tutor_410_05\".m_mContent: "Now, let's weave these clever tricks into our grand performance, just like a Magician would."

\"Tutor_310_01\".m_mContent: "Like an hourglass, the daily operations of the castle require regular attention to keep turning without pause."

\"Tutor_310_02\".m_mContent: "If I'm not mistaken, you, as the castle's steward, are in charge of these daily affairs."

\"Tutor_310_03\".m_mContent: "Indeed, Noah. You have entrusted me with this authority, and I am deeply honored. However, each day brings important matters that require your personal judgment."

\"Tutor_310_04\".m_mContent: "After weighing different perspectives, the final decision shall be yours to make."

\"Tutor_310_05\".m_mContent: "And each of your decisions will influence the Affinity between you and your Vassals. Ah, such is the dilemma of power."

\"Tutorframe_310_01\".m_mContent: "Invite your trusted Vassal to participate in the meeting."

\"Tutorframe_310_03\".m_mContent: "Hold the meeting and hear everyone's opinions."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_01\".m_mContent: "Moonlight spilled through the window, casting soft patterns across the floor. Ami stood in the light, quiet and still—as if waiting for someone."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_02\".m_mContent: "As promised, I've come to return your sketchbook—complete this time."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_04\".m_mContent: "That's it? Not even a word of thanks?"

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_05\".m_mContent: "To be honest... I'd already made peace with never getting it back."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_06\".m_mContent: "But you still asked me to help find the missing page."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_07\".m_mContent: "I just wanted to send you on a pointless errand."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_07a\".m_mContent: "And somewhere along the way, you realized you were hoping for something else."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_07b\".m_mContent: "Is this your way of punishing me for looking without permission?"

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_07a_1\".m_mContent: "When we talked about the drawings… I don't know why, but I suddenly wanted it back."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_07b_1\".m_mContent: "You didn't just look. You commented on everything, too."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_08\".m_mContent: "But why...? They were just meaningless doodles from the past..."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_09\".m_mContent: "Perhaps it’s only when we've grown that we see—but the ones who stayed by our side were the real treasures."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_10\".m_mContent: "Treasures? The Captain and the others always said the sea held countless treasures. That's why they felt so free, so happy, every time they set sail."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_11\".m_mContent: "And I couldn't leave like they did... Was it because my treasure had always been on the ship?"

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_12\".m_mContent: "In fact, your Captain already gave you the answer."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_13\".m_mContent: "You thought you were trapped aboard the ship—but you never noticed that the ship itself sails across the open sea."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_14\".m_mContent: "So I was... free? Was I actually the same as everyone else?"

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_15\".m_mContent: "Where do you think I found the final drawing?"

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_17\".m_mContent: "It was in the hands of a sailor from the El Dorado, corrupted by Black Blood. Even after losing his will, he still held onto this drawing with all his strength."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_18\".m_mContent: "Because your sketches captured something real—the freedom and joy you all once shared. And even now, that still meant something… to him."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_19\".m_mContent: "Why wouldn't they let you take on dangerous work? Why wouldn't they let you leave the ship? I'm sure you understand now."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_20\".m_mContent: "Those treasures at sea... Were they actually us?"

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_21\".m_mContent: "Or rather—from the moment you stepped aboard, you had already become their treasure."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_22\".m_mContent: "No matter where the ship sails, as long as you're not alone on the journey—that is what freedom truly means."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_23\".m_mContent: "Noah… I think I know what I want to do now."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_25\".m_mContent: "Looks like there's another story to look forward to. I wonder what kind of "life" you'll draw on a new page."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_10_26\".m_mContent: "You'll have to see for yourself... if you manage to find it again."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_01\".m_mContent: "I didn't expect you to actually come to me, my silver-haired friend. Aren't you afraid I might go back on my word... and have you executed again?"

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_02\".m_mContent: ""How someone treats their promises determines the color of their soul." Despite how you may seem, I believe you're someone who honors their word."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_03\".m_mContent: "Quoting my own words back to me—how like you. But knowing the kind of man you are, you didn't come all this way just for a reward, did you?"

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_04\".m_mContent: "Brennholt. Everyone at that manor you sent me to bears that family name."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_05\".m_mContent: "It's hard to imagine someone of your standing caring about a place so remote... Unless it's your hometown."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_06\".m_mContent: ""One cradle built from bone and breath, a corpse gave life, then slept in death.""

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_07\".m_mContent: "You remember the first "tale," don't you? I was born among corpses on the battlefield, then taken in by a slave owner and raised in that manor."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_08\".m_mContent: "All of us there were given the name Brennholt. We were slaves... but even so, we shared something close to peace."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_09\".m_mContent: "You mean all of you were slaves… and all called Brennholt?"

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_10\".m_mContent: "Looking back, I never questioned it at the time. I thought it meant we were a family. Until the eldest son of the Carrelle family came and chose the strongest among us..."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_11\".m_mContent: "Judging by your tone, he wasn't simply picking out slaves for labor in the city, was he?"

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_12\".m_mContent: "As a representative of the Bathory family, you must have heard of the Carrelles? Once one of the twelve noble clans, like your own. They were tasked with guarding the Heart of the Divine Body."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_14\".m_mContent: "The Heart must keep beating. And each pulse requires a living soul burned to ash to keep it going."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_15\".m_mContent: "So that's why he chose the strongest..."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_16\".m_mContent: "How ironic. We thought we were slaves who, despite our hardships, still owned our lives..."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_17\".m_mContent: "But in Lord Carrelle's eyes, we weren't even human. Our true purpose had always been to become the firewood that keeps the Heart beating."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_18\".m_mContent: "The people living in that manor now... Are they the descendants of your former companions?"

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_19\".m_mContent: "Should I say you have a kind and naive side too? That place was rebuilt to house war orphans like myself."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_20\".m_mContent: "As for why they also chose the name "Brennholt"... perhaps they simply don't know the story behind it."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_21\".m_mContent: "All my old companions—and their families—were burned. I was the only one who survived."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_22\".m_mContent: "And I still remember it all. Their screams. The stench of burning flesh."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_23\".m_mContent: "They say you never eat cooked meat... I see now—that wasn't just a rumor."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_24\".m_mContent: ""Two hearts beat in cursed accord, his flesh—the curse he can't afford." Was your survival... tied to the Heart?"

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_25\".m_mContent: "When I was thrown into that great furnace, I must have died—just as you did, when I set you alight."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_26\".m_mContent: "And yet here you stand. The flames took your life, but not your will. Just like me."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_27\".m_mContent: "I don't know what your resurrection felt like. But when I awoke, the pain—searing, like the torments of hell—never left me. Not to this day."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_28\".m_mContent: "To think the Church's most revered and feared Bell Ringer, the Poet of Flame, had been burned."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_29\".m_mContent: "To be honest, I still have no idea if it was the Heart or the fire itself that brought me back. When I opened my eyes, the heart was already gone."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_30\".m_mContent: ""Three siblings gone before their prime, devoured—his mourning etched in time. Four names he wore in borrowed skin, his shame engraved beneath his grin.""

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_31\".m_mContent: "The "three siblings" must refer to the Carrelle children. Those who tried to save us slaves, even defying their own blood. Especially the Second Princess..."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_32\".m_mContent: "They say she died in the same fire that gave me new life. Their deaths became part of my return. Isn't that its own kind of devouring?"

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_33\".m_mContent: "As for the "four names," they must be the four identities I've lived through—just as I told you."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_34\".m_mContent: "Slave. Chancellor. Bell Ringer. The Poet of Flame..."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_36\".m_mContent: "I already know the tales of the slave and the Bell Ringer. The Poet of Flame is well known, too. But the chancellor…"

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_37\".m_mContent: "After my resurrection, I found myself gifted with power beyond mortal men. And I never forgot who had stood with us… and who had not."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_38\".m_mContent: "So, I backed the Third Prince of Carrelle—the one who tried to save the slaves. Together, we overthrew the old and founded the new Carrelle nobility. Would you call that gratitude? Or revenge?"

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_39\".m_mContent: "More than either. What you did was a revolution. Now I see why you were chosen as a Bell Ringer."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_40\".m_mContent: "We're getting off track. Why don't we try interpreting the "five decrees" and "six wings" together..."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_41\".m_mContent: "Hm? What's this? You're in the mood to buy me a drink?"

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_42\".m_mContent: "Consider this tale the price of a drink. What I want to know is the "seventh tale" of Bell Ringer Agares Brennholt."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_43\".m_mContent: "The price of a drink... Those words remind me of someone dear—the Second Princess of Carrelle. The one who died with me in the fire."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_44\".m_mContent: "She was quite the drinker... Tell me—among those "ghosts" who told you stories about me... Was she one of them?"

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_10_46\".m_mContent: ""Seven drops of blood to stir what's yet ahead, and death shall be the place he makes his bed.""

\"Dialogue_L_Tris_10_01\".m_mContent: "At Tris's invitation, I attended the hymn recital at the church. Acappella, that young girl, proved to be truly gifted—her performance was met with thunderous applause."

\"Dialogue_L_Tris_10_02\".m_mContent: "After the performance, Tris approached me with a smile, her eyes sparkling with joy."

\"Dialogue_L_Tris_10_04\".m_mContent: "Acappella's adoption papers... the Church approved it?"

\"Dialogue_L_Tris_10_05\".m_mContent: "Thanks to you, Acappella can now start a new life with the other children in the choir."

\"Dialogue_L_Tris_10_06\".m_mContent: "Now I see why you call them 'children.'"

\"Dialogue_L_Tris_10_07\".m_mContent: "The choir takes these children in, and as the Commander, I naturally bear the responsibility of raising them."

\"Dialogue_L_Tris_10_08\".m_mContent: "It all began with a moment of mercy during a heretic's execution—that's when I brought Anna back with me."

\"Dialogue_L_Tris_10_09\".m_mContent: "As I executed more heretics, I came to realize that most of their children were innocent... A child shouldn't suffer for their parents' sins."

\"Dialogue_L_Tris_10_10\".m_mContent: "Then came Darcias, Acappella, and others. Decades have passed. Now, over forty children call this place home."

\"Dialogue_L_Tris_10_11\".m_mContent: "The Silver Blood keeps me from aging, while some of them have already entered their later years. Yet in my eyes, they are still children—in need of my care."

\"Dialogue_L_Tris_10_12\".m_mContent: "Being a Bell Ringer is my divine duty, but the choir... it's my haven in this cruel world."

\"Dialogue_L_Tris_10_13\".m_mContent: "I've indeed never met a Bell Ringer like you—one who adopts orphans and even welcomes a Bloodborn into the Church."

\"Dialogue_L_Tris_10_14\".m_mContent: "You're the special one, Noah. You not only helped me find the organ, but when everyone else opposed me, you alone understood my wish to adopt Acappella and nurture her talent."

\"Dialogue_L_Tris_10_15\".m_mContent: "You showed me that some things can transcend divides."

\"Dialogue_L_Tris_10_16\".m_mContent: "So today, you are not just a guest invited by a Bell Ringer. It's also a gesture of gratitude, from the choir and the Church, to you."

\"Dialogue_L_Tris_10_17\".m_mContent: "You are the one who should be thanked for discovering a talent like Acappella."

\"Dialogue_L_Tris_10_18\".m_mContent: "You seem to take particular notice of Acappella."

\"Dialogue_L_Tris_10_19\".m_mContent: "Actually... this was another reason I invited you here."

\"Dialogue_L_Tris_10_20\".m_mContent: "Acappella's love and talent for music must not go to waste. After years of dedication to the Church, my service has come to an end. I hope she will succeed me—becoming the Commander of the choir, and perhaps even the next Bell Ringer."

\"Dialogue_L_Tris_10_21\".m_mContent: "The child is gifted, but rather playful."

\"Dialogue_L_Tris_10_22\".m_mContent: "Sir Gadric mentioned you have considerable experience in training Vassals. Would you be willing to guide her together with me?"

\"Dialogue_L_Tris_10_23\".m_mContent: "This way, when I’m gone, there will be someone trustworthy to look after her."

\"Dialogue_L_Tris_10_24\".m_mContent: "Of course. But what do you mean by gone..."

\"Dialogue_L_Tris_10_26\".m_mContent: "A girl should keep some secrets of her own, Noah."

\"Dialogue_L_Tris_10_27\".m_mContent: "But if we meet again at the next recital... I might tell you the answer."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_10_03\".m_mContent: "Ah... this brings back memories. Wolfsbane was once my banner. I lost my family—and with them, the Wolfsbane too. Now, thanks to you, I've found it again."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_10_04\".m_mContent: "And it's not just the flower. With your help, I found a new friendship too."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_10_04a\".m_mContent: "So, does that mean I'm your friend now?"

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_10_04b_02\".m_mContent: "Just messing with you. Don't take it seriously."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_10_05\".m_mContent: "Whether it’s the adventures we shared before, or your help since I came to the castle, you’ve become a very important friend to me, Noah."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_10_06\".m_mContent: "I'll take your advice and learn to enjoy life."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_10_07\".m_mContent: "Actually, I have a surprise for you—one I planned even before you asked me to find the Wolfsbane. We've made a room in the castle into a solarium where you can enjoy the sunlight. You won't have to share a room with Dalcarlo anymore, and I've planted your favorite flowers there."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_10_09\".m_mContent: "Father and I once made a wish about Wolfsbane. I think he'd want me to move on now."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_10_10\".m_mContent: "Clive would want you to start a new life. And you know... both the Wolfsbane and the solarium were actually Empousa's idea too."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_10_11\".m_mContent: "Who would have thought? Despite all the bickering, you two actually get along quite well."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_10_12\".m_mContent: "I can tell you want to say thank you—but you should save it for Empousa."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_10_13\".m_mContent: "A new room, new memories, and... new friendships!"

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_10_14\".m_mContent: "Thank you all for being there for me!"

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_01\".m_mContent: "Since that last letter, there's been no word from Lamia."

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_02\".m_mContent: "Even after returning to the castle, there's still no sign of her."

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_03\".m_mContent: "Until that day, when I was about to leave and several bats suddenly appeared before me."

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_04a\".m_mContent: "Shouldn't you have left the castle by now?"

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_04a_02\".m_mContent: "No, I trust that you can solve this clue."

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_04b\".m_mContent: "Did No. 66's weapons fail to finish us all off?"

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_04b_01\".m_mContent: "How do you know I'm not here to "finish" you now?"

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_04b_02\".m_mContent: "If that was your intention, I believe you would have done it already."

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_07\".m_mContent: "You've only solved half of the clue."

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_08\".m_mContent: "Earlier, I thought what my "sister" achieved that I couldn't was winning you over, and that sister I was comparing myself to was Empousa."

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_09\".m_mContent: "But Cain said I was only half right—only the part about Empousa was correct."

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_10\".m_mContent: "Cain may be difficult, but he never lies. So there must be something she accomplished that you haven't yet."

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_11\".m_mContent: "But why does it have to be her again? Why is it so hard to surpass her?"

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_12\".m_mContent: "You seem particularly fixated on competing with Empousa."

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_13\".m_mContent: "If you were constantly compared to your "sister" from birth, knowing that only by surpassing her could you survive, you'd develop the same instinct."

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_14\".m_mContent: "It's a survival rule etched into my very bones. Even with the game over, my eyes remain fixed on my "opponent," terrified that a moment's lapse could spell eternal doom."

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_15\".m_mContent: "Silver-haired, I'm so tired of this predetermined game called life... What am I supposed to do?"

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_16\".m_mContent: "Sometimes, we don't need to find a way out—we just need to keep moving forward."

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_17\".m_mContent: "Easy for you to say. Keep moving forward? To where?"

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_18\".m_mContent: "How many spirits guard this gate? Am I supposed to face the entire Hall of the Elders alone?"

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_19\".m_mContent: "Beyond the gate? There's nothing there at all."

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_22\".m_mContent: "Outside those doors... there really is nothing at all..."

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_23\".m_mContent: "A sudden evening breeze swept in, carrying the hair ornament I had given to Lamia into the night sky."

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_24\".m_mContent: "As she frantically chased after the fluttering ornament, we unknowingly strayed far from the castle, arriving at the tree No. 66 had mentioned."

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_25\".m_mContent: "There's absolutely nothing under this tree. No. 66, you're quite the liar."

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_26\".m_mContent: "Of course... I should have known. We're all caged beasts—how could we possibly hide weapons outside the castle?"

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_27\".m_mContent: "All that talk about weapons to defeat everyone—it was just your ploy to lure me into escaping."

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_28\".m_mContent: "Perhaps... the escape itself was her gift to you?"

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_31\".m_mContent: "You mean she saw through my weariness, knowing I would eventually try to burn it all down..."

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_32\".m_mContent: "So before dying, she crafted that entire lie about the weapon to defeat everyone, just to lure me out of the castle?"

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_33\".m_mContent: "What she wanted to give me wasn't a weapon..."

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_34\".m_mContent: "What she truly wanted to give me... was freedom."

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_36\".m_mContent: "No. 66 always said the wind outside the castle sounded different from within."

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_37\".m_mContent: "I laughed at her foolishness—how could wind be any different?"

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_38\".m_mContent: "It wasn't until that moment, when I ran out of the castle, that I realized how wrong I was."

\"Dialogue_L_Lamia_09_39\".m_mContent: "The wind hadn't changed, but I had learned to run, and at last the world howled back in response."

\"Dialogue_L_Cain_10_02\".m_mContent: "Ah, this familiar taste... it's been so long."

\"Dialogue_L_Cain_10_03\".m_mContent: "The concentrated flavor of wild blackcurrants, with a remarkably weighty acidity..."

\"Dialogue_L_Cain_10_04\".m_mContent: "Wait! Why did you just drink it?"

\"Dialogue_L_Cain_10_06\".m_mContent: "Indeed, this is the Bloodborn Covenant, a private wine blend of the Bathory family from when Limine was still around. It's made from a mixture of Sangiovese and Black Moon grapes."

\"Dialogue_L_Cain_10_07\".m_mContent: "Before sealing the cask, they added a small amount of Limine's own blood. Though Bloodborn blood typically tastes bitter, when mixed with the wine, it created an unexpectedly distinct flavor profile."

\"Dialogue_L_Cain_10_08\".m_mContent: "I couldn't care less about how it tastes. Shouldn't you explain why you just drank what was supposed to be alchemical material?"

\"Dialogue_L_Cain_10_09\".m_mContent: "I never said I was conducting alchemical experiments."

\"Dialogue_L_Cain_10_10\".m_mContent: "Don't be angry. I'm actually trying to recreate the Bloodborn Covenant, but the taste isn't quite right yet. Surely you wouldn't mind helping me once more with a small blood donation?"

\"Dialogue_L_Cain_10_10b\".m_mContent: "Even our passionate hero has quite the temper."

\"Dialogue_L_Cain_10_11\".m_mContent: "With Bathory blood in your veins, you should be able to recreate that original taste better. This will be the last favor - I promise to share a bottle with you when we open the cellar next year."

\"Dialogue_L_Cain_10_12\".m_mContent: "And you can keep my alchemy notes too."

\"Dialogue_L_Cain_10_14\".m_mContent: "But your alchemy notes seem to be missing the final results?"

\"Dialogue_L_Cain_10_15\".m_mContent: "Because my experiments weren't successful, and I didn't continue them."

\"Dialogue_L_Cain_10_16\".m_mContent: "You're not the type to give up after failure."

\"Dialogue_L_Cain_10_17\".m_mContent: "Hah, indeed not. But you should know, I began studying Alchemy because of the legendary elixir of life."

\"Dialogue_L_Cain_10_18\".m_mContent: "Are you seeking immortality too? You don't seem like someone who'd need it."

\"Dialogue_L_Cain_10_19\".m_mContent: "Being immortal alone is rather dull. Wouldn't it be interesting to create another immortal being?"

\"Dialogue_L_Cain_10_21\".m_mContent: "Because elevating a species full of flaws to godhood would be too dangerous, and besides, I only wanted that one person who's already gone. Everyone else's company means nothing to me."

\"Dialogue_L_Cain_10_22\".m_mContent: "But seeing you reminds me of him..."

\"Dialogue_L_Cain_10_24\".m_mContent: "This is not something you should know. We've discussed far too many things we shouldn't have, so if you don't mind, I must ask you to leave."

\"Dialogue_L_Cain_10_25\".m_mContent: "Perhaps you'll know when the wine is ready next year."

\"Tutor_92_01\".m_mContent: "Well, now. This place hasn't seen a visitor in ages, living ones at that."

\"Tutor_92_02\".m_mContent: "I do sometimes long for company, but this is the family's forbidden grounds. You would do well to keep your distance."

\"Tutor_92_03\".m_mContent: "Is this place not abandoned? Why is there a strange man here?"

\"Tutor_92_04\".m_mContent: "I recall him. He was the keeper when the family renovated the castle long ago. His name was Augi-something..."

\"Tutor_92_05\".m_mContent: "Augustine. But after all these years, I never imagined that there were still survivors. I figured you to be old ghosts of the Aegis family."

\"Tutor_92_06\".m_mContent: "Let me show you how alive I am! That goes for the people who built this place with our flesh and blood, too!"

\"Tutor_92_07\".m_mContent: "The Aegis family's contribution to the Timeworn Mausoleum is quite extraordinary. As such, I shall make an exception and indulge you on the matter."

\"Tutor_92_08\".m_mContent: "Long ago, temporal rifts began to appear beneath this castle, allowing phantoms from other realms to escape into this world. In order to seal these rifts, the lord of the castle had this Timeworn Mausoleum built."

\"Tutorframe_92_01\".m_mContent: "Behind each stained glass window lies a hidden temporal rift."

\"Tutorframe_92_02\".m_mContent: "However, within these rifts you shall not find phantoms, but beasts."

\"Tutorframe_92_03\".m_mContent: "To prevent more phantoms from escaping, the family has established rewards for the cleanup."

\"Tutorframe_92_04\".m_mContent: "Each rift has a recommended DMG type."

\"Tutor_92_09\".m_mContent: "But rather than laboring with words, perhaps it is better to witness it with your own eyes."

\"Tutor_92_10\".m_mContent: "Since the dark-skinned lady here seems intrigued, please follow me."

\"Tutor_93_01\".m_mContent: "It's so dark in here, not a speck of light... Would it be too late to change our minds?"

\"Tutor_93_02\".m_mContent: "That's what everyone says. Well, let me first provide you with some guidance."

\"Tutorframe_93_01\".m_mContent: "The Temporal Rift behind you is where we entered. Our mission here is to prevent phantoms from travelling through the rift—at all costs."

\"Tutorframe_93_02\".m_mContent: "To prevent phantoms sneaking through while we're distracted, we must remain near the rift at all times. Do not move away from it."

\"Tutor_93_03\".m_mContent: "These phantoms are memories which have slipped here from other realms. It seems today we're dealing with a realm ruled by Blood Servants."

\"Tutor_93_04\".m_mContent: "Now, time for you to deal with them. And don't fear the unknown—you're stronger than you might imagine."

\"Tutor_94_01\".m_mContent: "Phantoms will always drop Past Relics, regardless of their strength."

\"Tutorframe_94_01\".m_mContent: "These items provide enhancements. Place them in your Inventory to buff your abilities."

\"Tutorframe_94_02\".m_mContent: "Do be careful, though—you may only select a limited number at a time. And if you get greedy,.. Well, foreign memories may corrupt your mind."

\"Tutorframe_94_03\".m_mContent: "As you're still adapting to this place, your Inventory remains quite limited."

\"Tutor_94_02\".m_mContent: "Now, take this bag while you're at it. It's nothing rare—you'll find more in the future."

\"Tutor_94_03\".m_mContent: "Next, select Nefertari's unique item—the sealed "Bow of Pyre"—and drag it to your Inventory."

\"Tutorframe_94_04\".m_mContent: "If you find certain items unsuitable, you can discard them at any time."

\"Tutor_95_01\".m_mContent: "Some items you collect remain sealed. This bow, for example, needs materials like saltpeter and lead to unseal."

\"Tutor_95_02\".m_mContent: "Well done, you've obtained the "Bow of Pyre.""

\"Tutor_95_03\".m_mContent: "In the future, you can combine items to create more powerful Past Relics."

\"Tutorframe_95_01\".m_mContent: "Drag cards to activate powerful skills from your unique items."

\"Tutor_97_01\".m_mContent: "For a first-timer, your performance was acceptable."

\"Tutorframe_97_01\".m_mContent: "As you clean up more rifts, your Insight will go up."

\"Tutorframe_97_02\".m_mContent: "Each time your Insight LV. increases, you'll gain rewards."

\"Tutorframe_97_03\".m_mContent: "Should you forget to claim them, rewards will accumulate here and can be collected at a later time."

\"Tutorframe_97_04\".m_mContent: "Here are your available rewards. Tap to collect them."

\"Tutor_97_02\".m_mContent: "It seems you've become distracted—perhaps there are more pressing matters at hand. Don't let me keep you."

\"Tutor_97_03\".m_mContent: "It's quite odd. Mr. Augustine gives off a peculiar feeling..."

\"Tutor_97_05\".m_mContent: "The feeling you speak of... a figment of your imagination. Until next time."

\"Tutor_91_01\".m_mContent: "How could there be a hidden stairway descending below?"

\"Tutor_91_02\".m_mContent: "As far as I know, the Bathory Castle is woven with a hidden network of underground passages. In keeping with the First Tenet of Secrecy, the ancient lords carved out a vast subterranean city—once the secret base of the family's operations."

\"Tutorframe_91_1\".m_mContent: "Wait... I think I've been here before, when I was very young... with my parents, a place my kin once called the 'Lost Courtyard.'"

\"Tutorframe_91_3\".m_mContent: "Yes, this is it! The same desolate air as before, though time has clearly left its mark here."

\"Tutorframe_91_4\".m_mContent: "It must have fallen into disuse alongside the family's decline after the Holy War. Decrepit, abandoned. From the remnants, it seems this was once where young Vassals were trained in the art of the hunt."

\"Tutorframe_91_5\".m_mContent: "As the family rises once more, and we progress through our journey in Threads of Fate, more facilities will gradually become available."

\"Tutorframe_91_6\".m_mContent: "Here you can undertake daily trials. These challenges not only hone your Blood Power but also provide substantial resource rewards."

\"Tutorframe_91_7\".m_mContent: "Look at that structure—it descends below ground. I wonder if hidden passages lie beneath..."

\"Tutorframe_91_8\".m_mContent: "Careful where you step! That place is dangerous. I remember it was..."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_01\".m_mContent: "In the outskirts of Bathory Castle at night, a spiritual gathering was taking place. People dressed in mysterious attire sat on the lawn around tents offering various services, including divination."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_02\".m_mContent: "Jacintha Dalcarlo, who happens to be here, stands outside a tent waiting for Noah to complete his divination inside."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_03\".m_mContent: "I can see that smile on your face. Was the divination accurate?"

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_06\".m_mContent: "She said I'm currently troubled by something that's been keeping me awake for a long time."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_08\".m_mContent: "She said this issue stems from interpersonal connections."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_10\".m_mContent: "Well, I can't say she was wrong... then she said, 'You must have had a quarrel with your lover.'"

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_12\".m_mContent: "She also said that the argument would be over quickly and that it would actually bring us closer together."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_13\".m_mContent: "Mhm, quite a sensible reading, I'd say..."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_14\".m_mContent: "Finally, she said that if I was skeptical about her words, she could describe my lover's appearance from her crystal ball."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_15\".m_mContent: "Light pink curls, mysterious eyes, and lips as red as blood."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_16\".m_mContent: "So that's what your lover looks like."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_17\".m_mContent: "She must have seen you when I lifted the tent flap and walked in."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_18\".m_mContent: "She was just applying the most probable 'lovers' quarrel' pre-made prediction because you wanted a divination on your own."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_18a_01\".m_mContent: "In the end, the divination was just a big farce."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_18a_02\".m_mContent: "For just a small sum, it bought your first smile of the evening. A worthwhile transaction, wouldn't you say?"

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_18b_02\".m_mContent: "Oh? So should our relationship move to the next level?"

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_18c_01\".m_mContent: "So diviners have such convenient pre-made predictions going around? If I learn this, could I set up my own stall and make some money?"

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_18c_02\".m_mContent: "If you want to set up a stall, you'll need to learn more than these."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_19\".m_mContent: "As a mysterious diviner and the elder of the Bathory family, would you grant me an answer true to my question?"

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_21\".m_mContent: "Was our meeting a decision you made, under the hand of fate."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_22\".m_mContent: "Our meeting on the ship, my discovery of your secret, my arrival at this gathering—all lead to that tarot deck."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_23\".m_mContent: "Are all your words to me merely the tarot's revelation?"

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_24\".m_mContent: "Do not be so quick to judge the tarot and divination. Your future will not be controlled by a deck of cards—or by me."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_25\".m_mContent: "That is not the true nature of tarot or divination, nor will it be the path I choose to walk."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_26\".m_mContent: "I thought you would be a staunch defender of the tarot."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_27\".m_mContent: "Instead, I'm merely a seeker of pleasure."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_28\".m_mContent: "I'm truly curious—after centuries of life, what is it you still pursue?"

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_29\".m_mContent: "When I first realized I could manipulate my own destiny, I was exhilarated. I ceaselessly sought to prove myself, and thus I set about changing many things. And I succeeded."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_30\".m_mContent: "That must have given you a profound sense of achievement."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_31\".m_mContent: "Yes, but after a while, I suddenly began to question myself. Why did I feel compelled to change everything?"

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_32\".m_mContent: "Sometimes, the designs of fate may seem cruel, but they're not without reason."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_33\".m_mContent: "Fighting against each twist of fate shaped me into a relentless warrior."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_34\".m_mContent: "Rebelling against destiny became your new destiny."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_35\".m_mContent: "That was when I finally understood—life is simply about pursuing what intrigues us."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_36\".m_mContent: "We need only be responsible for our present decisions."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_37\".m_mContent: "Yes... a simple truth that many grasp easily, yet it took me so long to understand."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_38\".m_mContent: "We are shaped by our past experiences. Everyone has issues that hold them down."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_40\".m_mContent: "What holds you back, little 'Fool'? Behind those veiled memories, what do you truly fear?"

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_42\".m_mContent: "Perhaps you have already found your answer when we meet again. Or perhaps the moonlight will grant you the insight you seek."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_44\".m_mContent: "Have you ventured into this gathering, completely unaware of the traditions of spiritual seekers, my little 'Fool'?"

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_45\".m_mContent: "We'll dance around the fire, converse, and relax under the moonlight, listening to nature's whispers."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_46\".m_mContent: "So... we will rest in the forest?"

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_47b\".m_mContent: "I still prefer resting in the castle."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_47a_01\".m_mContent: "The diviner’s hair carried the mysterious scent of burning incense. Her fingers, pale as moonlight, brushed my face with a warmth untouched by the cold moon."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_47b_01\".m_mContent: "Oh dear… it appears the trap did not go unnoticed."

\"Dialogue_L_Dalcarlo_10_47b_02\".m_mContent: "Would you be more tame next time, little one?"

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_Covenant_10_01\".m_mContent: "That fish took quite a bit of effort to catch. It's rare to find one bigger than you."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_Covenant_10_02\".m_mContent: "Yes, it's quite a rare scent indeed."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_Covenant_10_03\".m_mContent: "By the way, one of the fish in the kitchen was an incarnation of Calamity. That one didn't taste very good."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_Covenant_10_04\".m_mContent: "That's why it could summon you through the conch shell—they're both creatures of the sea."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_Covenant_10_04a\".m_mContent: "But why did you eat that fish as well?"

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_Covenant_10_04b\".m_mContent: "Why didn't you invite me to eat fish with you?"

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_Covenant_10_04a_01\".m_mContent: "I haven't seen fish this fresh since we left the El Dorado."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_Covenant_10_04b_01\".m_mContent: "I didn't know Bloodborn could eat human food like this."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_Covenant_10_05\".m_mContent: "Actually, I can gain certain memories, or rather, sensations, by consuming food."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_Covenant_10_06\".m_mContent: "But the fish in the kitchen didn't have any meaningful memories for me to see, so I had to ask you to catch some bigger ones."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_Covenant_10_08\".m_mContent: "I saw the perpetual worry etched on my clan members' faces as the sea levels continued to rise."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_Covenant_10_10\".m_mContent: "You saw the history of the Landis family's downfall?"

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_Covenant_10_11\".m_mContent: "Yes, the Calamity hidden in the conch shell wanted to merge with me, tempting me with promises of restoring the Landis family."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_Covenant_10_12\".m_mContent: "So I took a peek at the Landis family's history."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_Covenant_10_13\".m_mContent: "They were corrupted by the very Calamity they were supposed to guard, which led to all of Landis sinking beneath the waves."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_Covenant_10_14\".m_mContent: "Truth is, given how fast the sea levels were rising, Landis was destined to sink one day."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_Covenant_10_15\".m_mContent: "The Calamity exploited their weakness, manipulating them into committing irreversible acts."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_Covenant_10_16\".m_mContent: "If the entire island hadn't been dragged beneath the waves, they might have had a chance to find a new homeland."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_Covenant_10_17\".m_mContent: "Therefore, I will not be deceived by the Calamity again."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_Covenant_10_18\".m_mContent: "What's lost cannot be recovered. Someone must establish a new homeland."

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_Covenant_10_19\".m_mContent: "Look at you, little Ami, all fired up!"

\"Dialogue_L_Ami_Covenant_10_20\".m_mContent: "If there comes a day when the maritime empire returns to its former glory, I would love to see it."

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_01\".m_mContent: "These unclaimed letters could not be the end of her story..."

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_02\".m_mContent: "The moment the blood touched the Siren's Tear, I found myself once again pulled into the past..."

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_03\".m_mContent: "All evidence shows you are the Mistbound Terror, Miss Lorelei."

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_05\".m_mContent: "So what do you plan to do with me, Noah?"

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_06\".m_mContent: "I have one last question for you, Mistbound Terror."

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_07\".m_mContent: "Your plan is to have me kill you, isn't it?"

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_09\".m_mContent: "Your story shouldn't end in this Isle. You deserve to sing freely on the sea, to sail with your kin, and one day find your homeland afar."

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_11\".m_mContent: "An observer should not meddle in the game of chess, Noah from the future."

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_13\".m_mContent: "Because this isn't the past at all, little one."

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_14\".m_mContent: "This is merely a dream stirred by the Siren's Tear."

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_16\".m_mContent: "The power of Black Blood lingers in the Siren's Tear, resonating within you day after day."

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_17\".m_mContent: "The dream feels real, doesn't it? That's why Hallon was obsessed with turning Sapphire Isle into a land of dreams, and why the Master desperately sought the formula for Siren's Tear."

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_18\".m_mContent: "Don't lose yourself in it. Don't be another Hallon."

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_18a\".m_mContent: "I just can't forgive myself for killing you."

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_18a_01\".m_mContent: "It wasn't you who killed me, but my own sins and the evil I once committed."

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_18b\".m_mContent: "I just can't accept that I failed to save you."

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_18b_01\".m_mContent: "From the moment I took the path of a slayer, redemption became unworthy and unreachable."

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_18b_02\".m_mContent: "The tombstone you raised for me is my passage to freedom."

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_18c\".m_mContent: "I just can't believe I'm not the hero who changes fate."

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_18c_01\".m_mContent: "I'm just a side character, not meant to be noticed."

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_18c_02\".m_mContent: "Your journey still has so much brilliance to come. Keep moving forward."

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_21\".m_mContent: "Through the haze, I saw her walking toward the auction house, heading for her fate."

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_22\".m_mContent: "Was all of this... just an illusion?"

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_23\".m_mContent: "This package that came with the letter..."

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_24\".m_mContent: "Inside was the Siren Slayer's Sword of Honor. 'We salvaged this sword near the Isle and, not knowing what to do with it, turned it over to the Association.'"

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_25\".m_mContent: "This Future Artifact somehow triggered a mechanism upon the Mistbound Terror's death, recording new sounds."

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_26\".m_mContent: "Her final song woven with the cheers: 'Congratulations on slaying the siren!'"

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_27\".m_mContent: "This sound reminded me of all my deeds, and it was the final thread that still tied her to me."

\"Dialogue_L_Lorelie_10_28\".m_mContent: "The song echoed through the empty room."

\"Tutorframe_46_01\".m_mContent: "They look formidable. Let's find a way to hold them off."

\"Dialogue_L_VanHellsing_10_01\".m_mContent: "Didn't expect you to make it here."

\"Dialogue_L_VanHellsing_10_02\".m_mContent: "Finished my last case. And this one is too interesting to leave to you alone."

\"Dialogue_L_VanHellsing_10_03\".m_mContent: "Unfortunately, you arrived a step too late."

\"Dialogue_L_VanHellsing_10_07\".m_mContent: "Again? I came to find the letter—ran into the supposedly bedridden Duke entering the study."

\"Dialogue_L_VanHellsing_10_08\".m_mContent: "He can still walk? Doesn't seem that sick to me..."

\"Dialogue_L_VanHellsing_10_09\".m_mContent: "When he saw me, he yelled "Hilda" and fainted."

\"Dialogue_L_VanHellsing_10_11\".m_mContent: "So it was Reese II behind the ghost story all along."

\"Dialogue_L_VanHellsing_10_13\".m_mContent: "They couldn't let someone bearing the Reese bloodline walk away. Nor allow her to interfere with the marriage."

\"Dialogue_L_VanHellsing_10_14\".m_mContent: "Fortunately, Hilda's letter made her intentions clear—she planned to leave. That's how Reese II knew she hadn't taken her own life."
