\"Dialogue_L_VanHellsing_10_16\".m_mContent: "That's how Reese II got his chance for revenge."

\"Dialogue_L_VanHellsing_10_17\".m_mContent: "Making his father spend the rest of his life bedridden, living each day in constant fear of revenge... I must say, this method..."

\"Dialogue_L_VanHellsing_10_19\".m_mContent: "Now that we've wrapped up here… I've received a new case. Interested in joining me?"

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_03\".m_mContent: "I asked you out for a walk, and ended up dragging you around our family graveyard the whole day..."

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_04\".m_mContent: "And I wouldn't stop talking about old stories. That wasn't very appropriate, was it?"

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_06b\".m_mContent: "This is the privilege you gave me."

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_06b_02\".m_mContent: "I just felt like… you were the only one who'd truly listen."

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_06b_04\".m_mContent: "You don't have to think so hard about it..."

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_06c_02\".m_mContent: "Listening to those stories in a graveyard… Who knows, maybe the spirits are still here, eavesdropping."

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_06c_05\".m_mContent: "Though, if I'm being selfish… I'd prefer if the spirits weren't eavesdropping."

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_06c_07\".m_mContent: "Because I'd rather spend time alone with you."

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_09\".m_mContent: "And yet, you're the one who said you wanted to see me."

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_13\".m_mContent: "After hearing your stories… I realized just how fleeting life really is."

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_14\".m_mContent: "So I thought—some things are better said while there's still time."

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_21\".m_mContent: "No. They've gone quiet. After I helped that child find his comrades… those restless voices faded away."

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_22\".m_mContent: "I've been sleeping peacefully again. My condition's even improved."

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_24\".m_mContent: "But I might still die. No—I will die."

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_25\".m_mContent: "It's the curse of the Paracelsus family. That's how it's always been."

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_28\".m_mContent: "Not long ago… I was even thinking of ending it all. To erase the curse for good."

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_29\".m_mContent: "But when I saw that child's remains... I felt afraid again."

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_30\".m_mContent: "If I died and turned to bones too... Who would remember my mother? My grandmother? Anyone from our bloodline?"

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_31\".m_mContent: "That thought… It terrified me. But the more I fear, the clearer their voices get."

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_33\".m_mContent: "What if the pharmacy never made a pricing error? What if you hadn't insisted on helping me? What if you hadn't listened to all my rambling today…"

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_37\".m_mContent: "And mine may end sooner than most."

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_39\".m_mContent: "There are things that must be done while I still can."

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_42\".m_mContent: "Heh... And you said I was too direct."

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_45\".m_mContent: "I'll engrave every memory of Piera into my blood. And carry them with me."

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_49\".m_mContent: "Shall we go make some new memories?"

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_52\".m_mContent: "We've spent the whole day on your home ground. Isn't it time we moved to mine?"

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_56\".m_mContent: "Though come to think of it—are you sure you're up for staying out late?"

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_57\".m_mContent: "Don't worry. I'm not tired at all."

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_58\".m_mContent: "The sun sets and darkness creeps across the land."

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_59\".m_mContent: "Two figures walk side by side, slowly surrendering themselves to the embrace of shadow."

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_60\".m_mContent: "And before the endless night of fate descends. The maiden has already made her silent vow:"

\"Dialogue_L_Piera_10_61\".m_mContent: "She will not yield to resignation. Not in this brief, yet radiant life."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_01\".m_mContent: "As instructed, I visited Bella the moment I returned from Sapphire Isle."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_03\".m_mContent: "Oh my! If it isn't our silver-haired friend! Sadly, the shop's closed for the day—you'll have to come earlier next time!"

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_05\".m_mContent: "What?! You figured out one of Yakov's brilliant schemes?"

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_06\".m_mContent: "But—but everything I did was for Lady Bella's wish! Surely you wouldn't punish me... right?"

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_08\".m_mContent: "Oh no... what do I do now?! Her silence is terrifying! Silver-haired friend, say something!"

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_09\".m_mContent: "What kind of wish involves so many people? And more importantly—this wish doesn't seem related to the Puppet Association's business at all."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_10\".m_mContent: "It's a private matter. Come with me."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_12\".m_mContent: "Fragments of a girl named Bella. Pieces of personality—stripped away."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_13\".m_mContent: "We spent a fortune hiring Cain to dig into it, and found out Joyce was behind everything!"

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_16\".m_mContent: "But Elder Bella is the most special one—the core!"

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_17\".m_mContent: "Is Dalcarlo helping you gather the others?"

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_18\".m_mContent: "That's right! If we collect them all, we can awaken the complete Bella! And redeem her life from Joyce!"

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_19\".m_mContent: "Sounds like something out of a third-rate novel. My head hurts already."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_20\".m_mContent: "So Yakov told me all this on purpose… So that I'll help find the other fragments."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_21\".m_mContent: "We could also pretend none of this ever happened."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_22\".m_mContent: "Can we truly return to being just merchant and customer?"

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_24\".m_mContent: "But my wishes aren't what matter most. What do you want, Bella? Do you truly want to reclaim that life?"

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_25\".m_mContent: "Only humans have wants, longings. Can a puppet really have a will of its own?"

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_25a\".m_mContent: "It doesn't matter whether you're human or puppet."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_26\".m_mContent: "And if what I want is to reclaim my life?"

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_27\".m_mContent: "Then I'll help you with everything I have."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_28\".m_mContent: "And if I choose to continue living as I am?"

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_29\".m_mContent: "Then I'll remain by your side—just as I am now."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_30\".m_mContent: "Oh my! Yakov can practically smell the sweet scent of romance in the air!"

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_32\".m_mContent: "Mr. Derek mentioned you're well-read in philosophy."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_33\".m_mContent: "If it's not too much trouble… Would you mind staying the night? There's much I'd like to ask you."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_10_34\".m_mContent: "With you on our side, silver-haired one, buying back a life will be easy. At this rate, we could buy the moon itself!"

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_03\".m_mContent: "Here's the paint you asked for—along with the book you left with me."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_05\".m_mContent: "This covers the cost of the paint and your procurement fee."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_09\".m_mContent: "…Ah. You're attempting to replace Elder Bella through acts of charity."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_10\".m_mContent: "Don't let her hear you say that, or I'll be paying off another strange debt."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_11\".m_mContent: "This place... it's where you first met Tris, isn't it?"

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_13\".m_mContent: "It's where she killed my father and then adopted me."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_13a\".m_mContent: "Anna should teach you how to speak..."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_13a_01\".m_mContent: "Anna? What does she have to do with this?"

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_13b_01\".m_mContent: "This area is remote. The paths are difficult to navigate."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_15\".m_mContent: "Never mind. If you chose to meet me in such a meaningful place, this must be about more than just supplies."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_16\".m_mContent: "If you don't mind… tell me what's on your mind. Consider it payment."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_17\".m_mContent: "According to the dictionary, your behavior would be described as unusual."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_18\".m_mContent: "But I've often been called strange myself, so I don’t mind."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_19\".m_mContent: "The last time I felt sorrow, I was standing right here."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_20\".m_mContent: "My father, infected by Black Blood, killed my mother. Then Tris ended his life."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_21\".m_mContent: "I don't blame her. But the sorrow remained."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_22\".m_mContent: "After that, Tris brought me to the Church. I underwent the Silver Blood baptism."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_24\".m_mContent: "But it was that sorrow that helped me endure it. I lost many emotions that day—but I gained strength."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_26\".m_mContent: "But over time, I began to forget."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_27\".m_mContent: "My parents' faces blurred. Their voices grew faint. The bedtime stories they told me scattered into fragments."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_28\".m_mContent: "So this book is a memento from your parents...?"

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_29\".m_mContent: "No, I bought it from a street vendor."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_30\".m_mContent: "I just thought that if I read this book over and over, maybe I could remember them?"

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_31\".m_mContent: "Would that help me experience that sorrow once again?"

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_34\".m_mContent: "Sorrow is my source of strength. My reason to fight."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_35\".m_mContent: "If I forget it... then I've forgotten them."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_36\".m_mContent: "And as Acappella's Vice-Commander—if I lose that strength, I can't protect her."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_37\".m_mContent: "So that's why you came to me. You hoped I could help you feel again."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_39\".m_mContent: "But I misunderstood. That's why you said it wasn't the emotion you wanted."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_41\".m_mContent: "But thanks to you, I've experienced happiness. Joy."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_42\".m_mContent: "And now, to protect that happiness… I have even more reason to recover my sorrow."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_43\".m_mContent: "So that's why you brought me here."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_45\".m_mContent: "While looking up definitions in the library, I found that people express emotion through painting."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_46\".m_mContent: "So that's why you asked me for paint."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_48\".m_mContent: "Even if I forget again… looking at the painting might help me remember how I felt."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_50\".m_mContent: "But I haven't decided what to paint yet."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_51\".m_mContent: "Hey, do you remember that bedtime story?"

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_53\".m_mContent: "The wooden one who wanted to regain emotions had three companions."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_54\".m_mContent: "Just like how you have Tris, Acappella… and me."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_56\".m_mContent: "Then I'll wait for the day your painting is complete."

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_57\".m_mContent: "But there are others in the Choir too. Like Anna. Like—"

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_58\".m_mContent: "(Beneath the pure moonlight, Darcias begins to recite name after name.)"

\"Dialogue_L_Darcias_09_59\".m_mContent: "(Perhaps one day, the wooden one will recover all they have lost.)"

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_01\".m_mContent: "I arrived at the location Acappella specified."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_02\".m_mContent: "But I have no idea what kind of "commotion" to cause yet."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_05\".m_mContent: "I thought we were going to miss him again."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_06\".m_mContent: "Come on, I'm a Bell Ringer after all."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_08\".m_mContent: "But I can't help feeling that you two have been in contact behind the scenes."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_11\".m_mContent: "Darcias, how can you, as Vice-Commander, doubt the Bell Ringer you serve?"

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_12\".m_mContent: "Yes, I was overthinking things. I apologize."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_13\".m_mContent: "Hmph, I have a fugitive to catch. I don't have time for this."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_14\".m_mContent: "Stand still if you don't want to get shot."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_16\".m_mContent: "Acappella lowers her voice while making repeated eye signals."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_18\".m_mContent: "(Noah, it's time to act. Come on!)"

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_23\".m_mContent: "Since when did you become so skilled?!"

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_25\".m_mContent: "No, no, this wasn't how it was supposed to go!"

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_26\".m_mContent: "This is exactly how the capture plan was meant to go, and it worked perfectly."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_27\".m_mContent: "Unforgivable heretic of the Bloodborn, prepare to face judgment."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_30\".m_mContent: "Hey... would you at least listen to what I, the Bell Ringer, have to say?"

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_33\".m_mContent: "This vile Bloodborn needs no trial. I shall execute them on the spot."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_42\".m_mContent: "Stop pretending! You should be awake by now!"

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_47\".m_mContent: "You're too slow. I'll have to knock you all out and make a run for it."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_50\".m_mContent: "Did you never build a secret hideout as a kid?"

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_51\".m_mContent: "I don't remember anything from my childhood anymore."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_53\".m_mContent: "I'd rather completely forget everything that happened at the orphanage."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_54\".m_mContent: "Yet here you are, talking about it so casually?"

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_56\".m_mContent: "You know... I think you might know a bit too much."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_57\".m_mContent: "Usually, heads that know this many secrets go "BANG!" and get blown off."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_61\".m_mContent: "Noah Nevernight, I demand you tell me everything."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_62\".m_mContent: "Tell me, why is your heart racing so wildly right now?"

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_62a\".m_mContent: "If I'm not mistaken, mine isn't the only heart racing right now."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_62b\".m_mContent: "Because I'm rather enjoying this little game of cat and mouse."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_63\".m_mContent: "W-What are you suddenly saying such strange things for?!"

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_64\".m_mContent: ""I'll deliberately leave an opening, and you'll seize that chance to strike me down.""

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_65\".m_mContent: "Isn't that what you asked for in your letter?"

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_66\".m_mContent: "I-I was just... No... The plan has already failed, hasn't it?!"

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_67\".m_mContent: "Indeed, our game of cat and mouse is officially over."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_69\".m_mContent: "Acappella stared straight up at the sky, falling into an unusual silence."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_72\".m_mContent: "So, you should start thinking about what game we'll play next."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_75\".m_mContent: "Hmph, I knew that empty head of yours couldn't come up with any good ideas."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_76\".m_mContent: "This is clearly a job for the brilliant Acappella."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_78\".m_mContent: "Should we go somewhere further next time? No, let's go to the mountains!"

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_79\".m_mContent: "But there are way too many bugs in the mountains. Ah! Maybe we should..."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_80\".m_mContent: "The girl's endless chatter echoed through their secret hideout."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_81\".m_mContent: "The world never ceased its endless cacophony."

\"Dialogue_L_Acappella_10_82\".m_mContent: "But when two hearts beat as one, even chaos can become a sweet melody."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_01\".m_mContent: "So this was Hati's plan? To call me out, so you could speak with me before the power of [Homecoming] fades away."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_02\".m_mContent: "As I've said, she's far more perceptive than we give her credit for."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_03\".m_mContent: "Such a troublesome child... I was already prepared to leave quietly."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_04\".m_mContent: "You must sense it—Hati's own bloodline is constantly being assimilated by the Plague. It won't be long before my consciousness fades completely."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_05\".m_mContent: "But you never thought to say goodbye to her."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_06\".m_mContent: "As twins sealed within the "Womb" of the Divine Body, we faced a cruel choice—the Black Blood was running dry, and only one of us could survive."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_07\".m_mContent: "To ensure her survival, I chose to sacrifice myself, breaking down my body and blood into nutrients for Hati. That was the moment I said my goodbye to her."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_08\".m_mContent: "It seems you attacked us in the depths of the forbidden grounds to protect Hati before she was even born."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_09\".m_mContent: "I'm sorry. I had no other choice back then. I had to ensure Hati's safety before my strength ran out completely."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_10\".m_mContent: "Is that why you won't respond to Hati now—to spare her from feeling guilty?"

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_11\".m_mContent: "She's a serious child—stubborn, too. If she learns the truth, it might shake her to her core."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_12\".m_mContent: "I'm fading away soon enough. I don’t want my final memory to be of her looking sad."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_13\".m_mContent: "..."Knowing you're still by my side makes me happy, but I also feel a bit lost.""

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_14\".m_mContent: "These are... words Hati wrote for me?"

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_15\".m_mContent: ""I wanted to protect everyone, but in the end, I was the one being protected all along.""

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_16\".m_mContent: ""Father, Uncle Gadric, Clive Jr.... and you, Sheila.""

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_17\".m_mContent: "You silly girl... we're your family. We'd do everything to protect you."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_18\".m_mContent: ""To be honest, I used to feel so frustrated. Finally gaining power only to discover that those I wanted to protect were already gone.""

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_19\".m_mContent: ""But now I understand—even if you're not by my side, I can still protect you all!""

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_20\".m_mContent: ""The memories of the past, the home I once had, and... your very existence—these are all things I can protect!""

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_21\".m_mContent: "Yes... as long as your heart beats and memories flow, we will always be with you."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_22\".m_mContent: ""Thank you, Sheila. Please pass on my gratitude to Father and the others as well.""

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_23\".m_mContent: ""I won't be sad, because no matter where I go, I'll carry our memories with me.""

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_24\".m_mContent: "Wherever we are together is home... isn't it? Hati, you really have… grown."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_25\".m_mContent: ""The hopes Father entrusted to me, the future Clive Jr. passed on, and the power you've given me... I no longer need your protection.""

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_26\".m_mContent: ""If I may... from now on, let me...""

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_28\".m_mContent: "It seems Noah has already delivered my message to him."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_30\".m_mContent: "He's just tired. He's gone ahead to rest in your shared home."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_32\".m_mContent: "Actually, before today, Sheila came to me and asked me to keep his existence a secret."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_33\".m_mContent: "Then why did you still help me meet him?"

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_34\".m_mContent: "You're bound by chains called "the past." Though you've always held the key, you've never wanted to unlock them."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_35\".m_mContent: "You've grown so used to those chains that, even though removing them would set you free, they've become a part of who you are."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_36\".m_mContent: "I… don't really understand what you mean."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_37\".m_mContent: "Clive Jr., Gadric, and Sheila... Everyone wanted you to move forward. Yet it was precisely these bonds that kept you trapped in past regrets."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_38\".m_mContent: ""The chains"... So that's what it meant?"

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_39\".m_mContent: "As they left me one by one, I felt lost in a forest, alone and helpless."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_40\".m_mContent: "You're not lost—you're standing at the edge of the forest, hesitating to leave this place where memories dwell and face the unknown path ahead."

\"Dialogue_L_Hati_Covenant_10_41\".m_mContent: "I guess I won't be able to join Sheila and the others in their rest just yet—"

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_01\".m_mContent: "I thought we could only communicate through messages. I never expected to actually see you."

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_02\".m_mContent: "Would you call this "seeing" each other? If connecting through our thoughts counts as meeting, then yes, I suppose it does."

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_03\".m_mContent: "If two Noah Nevernights were to appear in the same place, it would likely lead to some irreversible consequences."

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_04\".m_mContent: "So this isn't the real world? Is it your afterlife—or mine?"

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_05a_01\".m_mContent: "Pretty much. After all, you are me, and I am you."

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_05b_01\".m_mContent: "That's up to your consciousness. You can certainly choose to see this all as a dream."

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_06\".m_mContent: "That "thing" you asked me to do last time... or rather, asked me not to do—I complied."

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_07\".m_mContent: "And the result is... Aunt Mary was killed."

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_08\".m_mContent: "At least, that's how it appears on the surface."

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_09\".m_mContent: "Why did you make me stand by and do nothing? Even if she never took care of me in this timeline, but in yours..."

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_12\".m_mContent: "In this timeline, I intervened in that conflict, and Mary was indeed saved."

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_13\".m_mContent: "But her son was killed taking an arrow meant for me."

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_14\".m_mContent: "Mary, having lost her only family, passed away a few days later, consumed by grief."

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_15\".m_mContent: "So her death... was it predetermined, like the cliff I'm destined to fall from?"

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_16\".m_mContent: "I don't know. I can't tell which events are the process and which are the result."

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_17\".m_mContent: "Your fall from the cliff is the predetermined result, while Aunt Mary's involvement is the process."

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_18\".m_mContent: "—So I will definitely fall from the cliff, but Aunt Mary might never appear."

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_19\".m_mContent: "Aunt Mary's death is the predetermined result, while her son's life or death is the process."

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_20\".m_mContent: "—So while we can't save the aunt, we can protect her son's future."

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_22\".m_mContent: "Different worlds, different people—what serves as the anchor point for this seemingly unchangeable predetermined fate we call "history"?"

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_24\".m_mContent: "Which is the result of "this world," and which is the process of "this person"?"

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_26\".m_mContent: "More specifically, to the will of people."

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_27\".m_mContent: "Everyone is the sole result of their own world, while others are the "processes" that help write this result with us."

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_28\".m_mContent: "So your appearance is a process in my world, and vice versa:"

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_29\".m_mContent: "You're also my process... so that's it? It's to help us find this answer together..."

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_30\".m_mContent: "Only then would that letter appear on my desk."

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_31\".m_mContent: "How ironic... in the end, it's still fate's choice?"

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_32\".m_mContent: "But whether we understand it, how we interpret it, and what choices we make—that still lies with us."

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_34\".m_mContent: "From where I stand, you're the one who's leaving."

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_35\".m_mContent: "Is it because we've found something that might be an "answer," and no longer need to stay in contact?"

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_36\".m_mContent: "Or could it be that Aunt Mary's world no longer needs us?"

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_39\".m_mContent: "This might sound strange, but... farewell, Noah Nevernight."

\"Dialogue_L_Noah_Covenant_10_40\".m_mContent: "Now I can't help but wonder… the next letter I receive…"

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_Summer_02_01\".m_mContent: "Mr. Nevernight, I hope this letter finds you well. I wish you all the best in your days after leaving Sapphire Isle."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_Summer_02_02\".m_mContent: "The doctor says I need plenty of rest and less physical activity. These days are just so dull."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_Summer_02_03\".m_mContent: "Has anything interesting happened to you? Would you tell me about it in your letter?"

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_Summer_02_04\".m_mContent: "I ended up writing quite a lot... If my letter is bothering you, please feel free to burn it."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_Summer_02_05\".m_mContent: "I just... lost the only friend I could confide in, and I feel a bit lost."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_Summer_02_06\".m_mContent: "What are you writing, little Bella! Am I not your most gentle, caring, and attentive friend?"

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_Summer_02_07\".m_mContent: "I've been thinking, once our next interactive performance is a huge success, we can make lots of money, cure your illness, cure my lifelong affliction of not having a golden staff, and then..."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_Summer_02_08\".m_mContent: "Wake up, I'm not a wish-granting sprite."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_Summer_02_09\".m_mContent: "Huh? Didn't you have that sparkling, firefly-like ability? Wait, you mean I can't make wishes to you?"

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_Summer_02_10\".m_mContent: "Wait, Bella, why did you faint? Guards! No, wait, there aren't any association guards left in the bay…"

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_Summer_02_11\".m_mContent: "Doctor! We need a doctor here, quickly!"

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_Summer_02_12\".m_mContent: "Look, Bella! You've got a letter from outside the bay!"

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_Summer_02_13\".m_mContent: "Your letters could never be a bother."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_Summer_02_13aa_01\".m_mContent: "The magnificent landscape there was completely different from Sapphire Isle."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_Summer_02_13ab_01\".m_mContent: "Unlike the ocean, you couldn't see where it ended."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_Summer_02_13a_01\".m_mContent: "If there's a chance, I'd love to bring you here to see the scenery."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_Summer_02_13b\".m_mContent: "Lately, I've been busy with work at the castle."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_Summer_02_13ba\".m_mContent: "Though it may be boring at times, it's a responsibility I must face."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_Summer_02_13bb\".m_mContent: "But my work is actually quite interesting."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_Summer_02_13b_01\".m_mContent: "If there's a chance, I'll show you around Bathory Castle."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_Summer_02_14\".m_mContent: "If I ever get the chance... do you think I could leave Sapphire Isle one day and see the world outside?"

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_Summer_02_15\".m_mContent: "The doctor said you shouldn't move around too much. If you need to write back, I can—"

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_Summer_02_16\".m_mContent: "Oh! I almost forgot I can't write!"

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_Summer_02_18\".m_mContent: "Mr. Nevernight, please show me all the unique places, people, and things around the world—through your letters."

\"Dialogue_L_Bella_Summer_02_19\".m_mContent: "Just like when you were still in Sapphire Isle, going on adventures with me."

\"Dialogue_L_Aiona_Lily_07_01\".m_mContent: "This little thing was so scared a moment ago, but now it has completely let its guard down. You really are something."

\"Dialogue_L_Aiona_Lily_07_02\".m_mContent: "It just came into this world. It's curious about everything around it, but also afraid..."

\"Dialogue_L_Aiona_Lily_07_03\".m_mContent: "I suppose we're all the same. Intrigued by the unknown, yet also fear it."

\"Dialogue_L_Aiona_Lily_07_04\".m_mContent: "But there are so many werewolves here, will we be able to get it out unharmed?"

\"Dialogue_L_Aiona_Lily_07_05\".m_mContent: "The situation is far more dire than what the Church had told us. Friedrich and Gilrain... would they be willing to risk themselves for a little lamb..."

\"Dialogue_L_Aiona_Lily_07_06\".m_mContent: "We'll make it out of here, Aiona."

\"Dialogue_L_Aiona_Lily_07_07\".m_mContent: "Mm... I'll make it my birthday wish this year—to escape from here with the little lamb."

\"Dialogue_L_Aiona_Lily_07_08\".m_mContent: "It came to me today, and I want to raise it and watch it grow."

\"Dialogue_L_Aiona_Lily_07_10\".m_mContent: "Yes. Noah, do you know anyone else who shares the day with me?"

\"Dialogue_L_Aiona_Lily_07_11\".m_mContent: "I'm not really sure what day they were born..."

\"Dialogue_L_Aiona_Lily_07_12\".m_mContent: "Actually, on my past birthdays, I would always receive a letter from a stranger. They would encourage me to keep going whenever I felt lost."

\"Dialogue_L_Aiona_Lily_07_13\".m_mContent: "Meeting you here today, I had this wild thought—could you be that mysterious person who wrote to me?"

\"Dialogue_L_Aiona_Lily_07_13a_01\".m_mContent: "After all, everything I experienced in the past has probably been forgotten now."

\"Dialogue_L_Aiona_Lily_07_14\".m_mContent: "For my birthday wish this year... may the Saint's power protect this little lamb as they grow."

\"Dialogue_L_Aiona_Lily_07_15\".m_mContent: "But the Church is not the shepherd that protects you."

\"Dialogue_L_Aiona_Lily_07_16\".m_mContent: "The church may seem overly harsh toward those with Black Blood like you, but their goal is to eradicate this disease from the land."

\"Dialogue_L_Aiona_Lily_07_17\".m_mContent: "So they made the innocent Ganelon family—and other families kept in the shadows—bear the misfortune of sealing the Calamities."

\"Dialogue_L_Aiona_Lily_07_18\".m_mContent: "Even when things started to spiral out of control, they simply forced another family to clean up the mess."

\"Dialogue_L_Aiona_Lily_07_19\".m_mContent: "No, you're trying to shake my faith..."

\"Dialogue_L_Aiona_Lily_07_20\".m_mContent: "I’m merely offering you counsel. In the near future, you will understand all of this."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_Covenant_10_01\".m_mContent: "Inviting me to drink wine under the moonlight... It seems you haven't found that person."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_Covenant_10_02\".m_mContent: "But at least I got this earring back... and a letter she left for me."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_Covenant_10_03\".m_mContent: "I imagine the letter's contents are related to your promise."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_Covenant_10_04\".m_mContent: "She understood early on that only through war could we reach the future we all yearned for—a future built on freedom."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_Covenant_10_05\".m_mContent: "But in her eyes, ever since I became the Bell Ringer, war seems to have turned into a weapon that destroys freedom."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_Covenant_10_06\".m_mContent: "You are the leader of the Inquisition, entrusted with carrying out the Church's orders to punish heretics and uphold its authority."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_Covenant_10_07\".m_mContent: "It's no different from what the Carrelle family did back then."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_Covenant_10_08\".m_mContent: "Perhaps that's why she took the earring... In her eyes, I'm gradually becoming another Carrelle."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_Covenant_10_10\".m_mContent: "Looks like you've figured out why she didn't."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_Covenant_10_11\".m_mContent: "Because you never forgot about that earring and the promise it carries."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_Covenant_10_12\".m_mContent: "After your resurrection, instead of overthrowing the Carrelle family immediately, you liberated other slaves and gathered allies who shared your cause, waiting for the perfect moment."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_Covenant_10_13\".m_mContent: "And now, just like before, you're quietly waiting for the opportunity to start the war."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_Covenant_10_14\".m_mContent: "War, huh... It feels like you're mocking me for just being endlessly patient."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_Covenant_10_15\".m_mContent: "Or perhaps you're gathering strength. If I remember correctly, your crimson flames symbolize destruction, while the azure flames that almost no one has seen..."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_Covenant_10_17\".m_mContent: "With these azure flames that grant second life, you raised an army to stand against the Church, commanding the dead to fight for you."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_Covenant_10_18\".m_mContent: "Why would I want to get involved in something this complicated?"

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_Covenant_10_19\".m_mContent: "Peace can be destroyed by war, yet war is the only way to build peace—what you seek is a war that will completely end the old era."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_Covenant_10_20\".m_mContent: "Phew... I don't know whether it's good luck or bad that you saw right through me."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_Covenant_10_21\".m_mContent: "Yet you still share this wine with me."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_Covenant_10_22\".m_mContent: "Because you were the strength I needed all along."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_Covenant_10_23\".m_mContent: "I deliberately exposed my whereabouts to the lady of the Bathory family, and allowed her to take your blood, granting you new life."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_Covenant_10_24\".m_mContent: "By now, the Church might just see us as accomplices."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_Covenant_10_25\".m_mContent: "You seem quite certain I'll stand by your side."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_Covenant_10_26\".m_mContent: "You already are—standing by my side, drinking with me."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_Covenant_10_27\".m_mContent: "To my accomplice, and to the coming war."

\"Dialogue_L_Agares_Covenant_10_28\".m_mContent: "Then here's to you, the warmonger who claims to be a peace advocate."

\"Tutor_130_01\".m_mContent: "It's been a while. How are you getting along with your new Vassals?"

\"Tutor_130_02\".m_mContent: "If you still have the appetite for it... I believe it's time I introduced a few old friends"

\"Tutor_130_04\".m_mContent: "These three coffins... are they the "old friends" you mentioned?"

\"Tutor_130_05\".m_mContent: "Permit me a proper introduction. Before you lie the former Elders of the Bathory family, long consigned to eternal slumber."

\"Tutor_130_06\".m_mContent: "In the Holy War of ages past, they gave all they had for their bloodline... only to be lost to the river of time."

\"Tutor_130_07\".m_mContent: "But now, as our family stirs once more, it is time to awaken them, to let them bear witness to our rebirth and rising glory."

\"Tutor_130_09\".m_mContent: "To rouse a soul long sealed in slumber, one requires a singular reagent—the "Mead of Rebirth"."

\"Tutor_130_10\".m_mContent: "Once the Mead of Rebirth fills the coffin, the Elder shall awaken."

\"Tutor_130_11\".m_mContent: "Earn this rare mead by completing daily tasks or distinguishing yourself in Clan Wars."

\"Tutor_130_12\".m_mContent: "The three former Elders did not enter slumber all at once. Once we awaken Elder Sirene and one other, the 'legend' shall return to this world."

\"Tutor_131_01\".m_mContent: "Look, Silver-haired! That sluggish vendor's put out a bunch of new prizes!"

\"Tutor_131_02\".m_mContent: "Isle Coins and Moon Tears... If I can win those, I'll be one step closer to paying off my debt!"

\"Tutor_131_03\".m_mContent: "Let's go one more round? Pleeease, Silver-haired!"

\"Tutor_131_06\".m_mContent: "Same rules as before, right? If a siren shows up, just whack it!"

\"Tutor_131_07\".m_mContent: "Heh... "The Deadly Arrow" never misses its mark!"

\"Tutor_132_01\".m_mContent: "So this is Sapphire Isle, the famed summer paradise?"

\"Tutor_132_02\".m_mContent: "The air's full of that mouthwatering scent... Must be Clammond, Krillon, and Squiddrick, freshly grilled."

\"Tutor_132_03\".m_mContent: "An auction house, curious vendors... Looks like there are plenty of places worth <style=Highlight>exploring</style> here."

\"Tutor_132_04\".m_mContent: "That red-haired lady seems to be one of the Isle's overseers. Perhaps she can tell us where to begin."

\"Tutor_133_01\".m_mContent: "Constantine's memories mention something about the Isle. Just what happened at Sapphire Isle, eleven years ago—on this day?"

\"Tutor_133_02\".m_mContent: "Memory Fragments unlocked: <style=Highlight>[Eleven Years Ago – Ninth Hour]</style>, <style=Highlight>[Eleven Years Ago – Sunset Hour]</style>, <style=Highlight>[Eleven Years Ago – Tenth Hour]</style>. Tap to view."
